(1)順序。
「式の～」「車の～定めにくければ/宇津保（楼上・上）」
(2)現在に至るまでに， 物事がたどった道筋。 事情。 いきさつ。
「事の～を話す」「かような～で面目ない」「事と～によっては一肌脱ごう」
(3)謡曲の詞章の名。 七五・返句・七四， または七五の句から成り， 多くは脇役の登場第一声として謡われ， 役の意向や感慨を述べる。 また， 曲中で曲舞(クセマイ)や乱拍子の序歌として謡われることもある。
(4)順序を追ってすること。 順序よく並べること。
「仏名の所， 大徳たち， ～してひきゐて七八人参る/宇津保（嵯峨院）」
※二※ （接尾）
(1)名詞に付いて， その人の意向， またはその事物の事情いかんによるという意を表す。
「どうするかはあなた～だ」「とかくこの世は金～」
(2)動詞の連用形に付いて， 動作が行われるままにという意を表す。
「成り行き～」「手当たり～に投げつける」
(3)動詞の連用形または動作性の名詞に付いて， その動作に続いてすぐにという意を表す。
「満員になり～締め切る」「送金～現物を送る」

II つぎて【次第】
〔動詞「つぎつ（継）」の連用形から〕
次第。 順序。 ついで。
「諸皇子等～を以て各誄(シノビゴト)まうす/日本書紀（推古訓）」

しだい【次第】
1 〔順序〕 order; precedence.
2 〔事情〕 circumstances.
●こういう次第で such being the case; in [under] the [these] circumstances.
●事と次第によっては according to circumstances; if occasion requires.
●事の次第はこうです. This is how it happened.
・まあざっとこんな次第です. These are, in brief, the facts of the case.
・以上のような次第です. The facts of the matter are as above stated.
3 〔(名詞について)いかんによる〕
●練習次第で with practice; if one practices (hard enough); depending how hard one practices
・腕次第で according to one's ability; if one is good [skillful] enough; depending how skillful one is
・考え方次第で depending how you think about [view] 《it》
・…次第である depend on…; hang [ride, hinge, turn] on…; be conditional [dependent, contingent] on…; rest [lie] with….
●万事金次第の世の中だ. Money talks [makes the world go round]. | Everything is possible with [if you have] money.
●生徒は教師次第でよくも悪くもなる. A student is what a teacher makes him or her. | Students turn out well or badly depending on the teacher.
・未来が開けるかどうかは本人[自分]次第である. What you make of the future [Whether you make a success of life] depends (entirely) on you. | It's up to you whether the future turns out well.
・行く行かないは君次第だ. The decision whether to go or not lies with you. | It's up to you whether you go or not.
・ご注文次第でどのようにも作ります. It will be made any way you wish, according to your specifications.
・これから先は君の腕次第だ. Now everything [The rest] depends entirely on your ability [how good you are].
・万事は彼の決心次第だ. Everything hinges on how he decides [hangs on his decision].
・失敗がプラスとなるかならないかはその受けとめ方次第だ. How you accept it decides whether a failure can be a positive experience or not.
・彼はその日その日の風次第さ. He is leading a roving life.
4 〔(動詞の連用形や動作性名詞について)即刻〕 as soon as; directly; immediately.
●到着次第 as soon as one arrives; on [immediately after] one's arrival
・ご都合つき次第 at your earliest convenience
・天気になり次第 as soon as it is fine; on the first [next] fine day
・雨が止み次第 as soon as the rain stops [it stops raining]
・落とし物が見つかり次第ご連絡いたします. We'll contact you immediately we find what you've lost.
●連絡が入り次第すぐ出発できるよう用意した. I got ready to start at a moment's notice [as soon as they contacted me].
・ご注文の品が入り次第お送りいたします. We'll send your order as soon as it comes [the goods come] in.
・品物を受け取り次第送金いたします. I will send the money on receipt of the goods.
・お申し込みがあり次第カタログをお送りします. Catalogues (can be) sent [dispatched] immediately on application [request].
5 〔(動詞の連用形などについて)放題〕 [＝-ほうだい]
●手当たり次第 ⇒てあたりしだいに.
●褒美は望み次第. You shall be rewarded as you wish.
式次第 the program [order] of the ceremony.
次第書き a (written [printed]) program; a bill.

ほんば【本場】
(1)あるものの主な産地。 よい品の産地。
「カキは広島が～だ」
(2)物事が盛んに本式に行われている場所。
「ファッションの～」「～仕込みの芸」
(3)証券・商品取引所の午前の立ち会い。 前場(ゼンバ)。

ほんば【本場】
1 〔本来の産地〕 a home; a habitat; the (best) place 《for…》; 〔中心地〕 the (productive) center.
●ミカンの本場 the home of the tangerine
・サッカーの本場 the home of soccer [《英》 football].
●本場から取り寄せたスパイス spices obtained from the places of their origin.
●(フランス料理などを)本場で修業する learn sth where it originated from.
●本場の西陣織 genuine Nishijin brocade
・本場の英語 English as it is spoken by its native speakers
・やっぱり本場の味は違うね. It tastes best in the land of its birth, right?
●カキは広島が本場だ. Oysters of excellent quality are produced in Hiroshima.
・宇治はお茶の本場です. Uji is one of the famous tea-growing centers of Japan.
・レゲエの本場であるジャマイカへ行ってきた. I visited Jamaica, homeland of reggae music.
2 【取引】 the morning session; the last session in the morning.
本場仕込み
●彼は本場仕込みのフランス語を話す. He speaks a French that he learned in France.

I かど【門】
(1)家の出入り口。 もん。 また， その前。
「～を出る」
(2)屋敷。 いえ。
「笑う～には福来たる」
(3)家族。 一門。 一族。
「みな～わかちたまへりけり/大鏡（藤氏物語）」
～打(ウ)・つ
（近世， 江戸などで犯人の逃亡などを防ぐため）木戸・門をとじる。
～た・つ
門の扉をしめる。
「～・てて戸は閉(サ)したれど盗人の/万葉 3118」
～に立(タ)・つ
（物乞いなどのために）門口に立つ。
～広・し
一門が繁盛している。
「その後なむ～・くもなり侍る/竹取」
～を出(イ)・ず
(1)家を出る。
(2)出家して僧や尼となる。
～を広・ぐ
子孫を増やし， 一族を栄えさせる。
「この門ひろげさせ給ひて， 侍らずなりなむ後にも/源氏（薄雲）」

II と【門・戸】
(1)家の出入り口。 戸口。 かど。 もん。
「後つ～より逃げ出でて/古事記（中訓）」
(2)海峡などの， 両岸がせばまった水流の出入りする所。 水門(ミト)。 瀬戸。
「天離る鄙(ヒナ)の長道ゆ恋ひ来れば明石の～より大和島見ゆ/万葉 255」

III もん【門】
※一※ （名）
(1)家の外構えやある敷地に設けた出入り口。 かど。
「～を閉める」「～をくぐる」「公園の～のところで待っている」
(2)物事が出入り， また経由する所。
「入試の狭き～を突破する」「登竜～」
(3)ある師をとりまく学問・芸道などの一派。 また， その系譜。
「漱石～の俊秀」
(4)生物分類上の一段階。 界の下， 綱の上。 脊椎動物門など。
→ 亜門
(5)「門限」の略。
「いやもう， 直に帰らう， ～がやかましい/洒落本・辰巳之園」
※二※ （接尾）
助数詞。 大砲を数えるのに用いる。
「四六センチ砲九～」
～に入・る
弟子(デシ)入りする。 入門する。
～を叩(タタ)・く
師と仰ぐ人を訪ねて， 弟子(デシ)入りを願う。

IV もん【門】
小説。 夏目漱石作。 1910年（明治43）発表。 親友の妻お米と結ばれひっそりと暮らす主人公野中宗助は， 不安から宗教の門をたたくが， 入ることができない。 社会の片隅の幸福の裏にひそむ精神の不幸を描く。

Iかど【門】
〔もん･門のあたり〕 a door; a gate. [⇒もん2]
●門先で[に] in front of a house; at the (front) gate [door].
●家の門に立って見送る stand at the front gate and see off 《a visitor》
・笑う門に福来る. ⇒わらう 1.
・門ごとに国旗が翻っている. The national flag is fluttering beside every door.
IIもん【門】
1 〔家の〕 a gate; 【解】 〔内臓･血管などの〕 a hilum 《pl. -la》.
●裏門 a back [rear] gate
・入口[出口]の門 an entrance [exit] gate
・寺の門 the gate of a Buddhist temple
・狭き門 the strait gate 《to Heaven》; 〔大学など〕 a highly competitive university [school]; a difficult college to enter [get into]
・この大学は狭き門として定評がある. This college is universally acknowledged to be very difficult to get into.
●門が閉まっている. The gate is closed.
●門から入る[出る] enter [go out] at the gate.
●門に表札がかかっている. There is a nameplate on the gate.
・門に国旗が翻っていた. The national flag was flying over the gate.
●門の前を通る pass the gate
・門のない gateless
・門のところ[外側, 内側]にたたずむ stand at [outside, inside] the gate.
●門をくぐる pass [go] through a gate
・門をたたく knock at [on] the gate; 〔訪ねる〕 call on sb
・門を閉じて人を入れない shut the door to visitors.
2 〔ある師を頂点とする芸術や学問の派閥〕
●…の門に入る become a pupil of…
・田中一郎の門に学ぶ study under (the tuition of) Tanaka Ichirō
・前途有為の青年が多数山田先生の門に集まった. Many young people with promising futures flocked to Professor Yamada.
●門をたたく knock at the gate; ask to be taken on as a trainee
・彼が師の門をたたいたのは 18 歳の時だった. It was at the age of 18 that he became a disciple [pupil] of the teacher.
・…の門を出る study under (the auspices) [at the feet] of….
3 〔生物分類の〕 【動】 a phylum 《pl. -la》; 【植】 a division. <▲> なお, 門以下の分類階級は, 綱 (class), 目 (order), 科 (family), 属 (genus 《pl. genera, genuses》), 種 (species 《pl. ～》), 亜種 (subspecies), 変種 (variety), 品種 (form) の順になる.
脊椎動物門 Phylum Chordata [Vertebrata].
門形クレーン 【機】 a goliath (crane); a portal crane.

いし【医師】
〔古くは「いじ」とも〕
(1)医師法に基づき， 傷病の診察・治療を職業とする人。 医者。
(2)律令制で， 典薬寮の職員。
(3)江戸幕府で， 医療を担当する職員。 奥医師・表医師などに分かれる。

いし【医師】
a (medical) doctor; a physician; a (medical) practitioner; a medical scientist; a medical man. [＝いしゃ1]
●新米の医師 a newly qualified physician
・〔呼び方として〕 小原医師 Dr. Ohara.
●離島では医師が不足している. There is a lack of doctors on the outlying islands.
・首相の病状について担当の医師が記者会見をした. The doctor [physician] in charge held a press conference on the Prime Minister's condition.
●執刀した医師に過失はなかった. The doctor [surgeon] who operated was not negligent. | There was no negligence on the part of the doctor who performed the operation.
・かかりつけの医師に相談する consult one's (family) doctor.
●断食は医師の指導のもとに行わないと危険だ. Fasting is dangerous if not done under the direction [guidance] of a doctor.
・おかしいなと思ったら, 早めに医師の診察を受けましょう. If you feel a bit strange, see [consult (with)] the doctor at once.
・それは医師の処方箋がないと手に入らない薬です. That's a drug that can only be obtained on [with] a doctor's prescription.
・私は医師の許可がおりたので一晩自宅に帰ります. The doctor has given (his) permission [I've got the doctor's permission], so I'm going to spend the night at home (away from the hospital).
・彼は医師の免許がないのに診療行為を行ったとして逮捕された. He was arrested for practicing as a doctor without a license.
・幸い, 医師の心得のある人がいて, 機内での出産を助けてくれた. Fortunately, there was someone with medical training on board, who helped with the in-flight birth.
●それは医師としてのモラルの問題だ. That is a problem of medical ethics [one's ethics as a doctor].
・診察した医師は「おめでたですね」と言った. The doctor who examined her said, “You're going to have a baby.”
歯科医師 a dentist; a dental surgeon [practitioner].
医師会 a medical association [society].
医師開業有資格者 a licensed [qualified] doctor [physician]; a person licensed [qualified] to practice medicine.
医師団 a team of doctors; a medical team.
医師免許状 a medical license; a physician's diploma [license]; a license to practice medicine.
医師免許取消 revocation of a medical [doctor's] license. [⇒いぎょう 医業停止(処分)1]
医師優遇税制 a preferential tax system for physicians; a system of tax examption for doctors.

じゅんばん【順番】
かわるがわるその事に当たること。 また， その順序。
「～がまわってくる」「～に鬼になる」

じゅんばん【順番】
〔順序〕 order; 〔輪番〕 turn. [⇒じゅん3, ばん4]
●順番が来た. My turn has come.
・なかなか順番が来ない. It seems like my turn isn't going to come.
・2 時間並んでようやく順番が回ってきた. After waiting two hours, my turn finally came.
・順番が逆である. The order's backwards.
●山登りではいつも母, 私, 父の順番で歩く. Whenever we climb a mountain, we always walk in the order Mother, me, and Father.
・トーナメントではどの国とどんな順番で対戦するかが結果を左右する. In a tournament, the order in which countries face one another affects the final outcome.
●順番に in (regular, due) order; in turn; by turns; in [by] rotation
・順番に歌う[スピーチをする] sing [make speeches] in turn
・順番に診ますのでもう少しお待ちください. Consultations are carried out in order, so please wait a little longer.
・わが家では家族全員が順番に夕食を作る. At home each member of the family takes turns cooking dinner.
・どうぞ順番に願います. In order, please.
・「掃除はだれがやる?」「3 人で順番にしよう」 “Who will do the cleaning?”―“Let's the three of us take turns doing it.”
・オランダの国旗は上から順番に赤, 白, 青だ. The national flag of the Netherlands is, in order from the top, red, white and blue.
●順番を待つ await [wait (for)] one's turn; 〔客として〕 wait for service
・臓器移植の順番を待つ await one's turn for an organ transplant
・順番を決める set [determine] the order
・順番を狂わす alter [disturb] the order; mix up the order
・順番を無視する ignore the (proper) order; 〔列に割り込む〕 jump the 《米》 line [《英》 queue].
順番取り getting [holding] a place (in the line [《英》 queue]).
●先着順だったので, 順番取りのため早めに申込書だけ送っておいた. It was a first-come, first-served system, so I sent off an application just to get a place in the queue [myself on the list]. | They were dealing with the applications in order of arrival, so I sent one in just to secure myself a place.

たんき【短気】
気が短いこと。 辛抱ができずに， すぐに怒ったり飽きたりすること。 また， そのさま。 気みじか。
「～を起こす」「～な人」「『其様(ソン)な事を私が知るもんかね』と～に云ふ/はやり唄（天外）」
～は損気(ソンキ)
短気を起こすと結局は自分が損をする。 短気は功を成さず。
～は未練(ミレン)の＝元(モト)（＝初(ハジ)め）
短気を起こすと後悔することが多く， 未練が生じて， のちのち苦しむことになる。

たんき【短気】
a short [quick, hot, bad, hasty, violent] temper; 〔怒りっぽさ〕 irritability; irascibility; petulance; touchiness; 〔性急さ〕 impatience; hastiness; impetuosity.
～な quick-[hot-]tempered; 〔怒りっぽい〕 irritable; irascible; petulant; touchy; 〔性急な〕 impatient; hasty; impetuous.
●短気な性格 an irritable character
・短気な人 a hot-[short-]tempered person; a person with a (short) temper; a hothead
・短気な行動をする act [behave] rashly; do sth rash; act on impulse
・くれぐれも短気なまねはしないように. Please keep [don't lose] your temper. | 《口》 Keep your cool [head (on)].
●短気である be quick-[short-, hot-]tempered; have a quick [short, hot] temper.
●彼の短気が災いしたようだ. His quick temper seems to have spoiled his chances.
・彼女のあの短気が身の破滅になった. Her short temper was her downfall.
●短気を起こして in a fit of ill temper; out of temper
・短気を起こす lose (one's) temper; get out of temper; become impatient [irritated]; fly into a passion [rage]
・短気を起こさずにもう一度考え直す keep [control, restrain] one's temper and think again
・そんなことで短気を起こすものじゃない. Don't let such a thing ruffle your temper.
●彼は短気ですぐ怒る. He soon loses his temper [《口》 flies off the handle].
・〔占いなどで〕 性格は短気. Character: short-tempered. | You are short-tempered in character.
・短気は損気. Haste makes waste. 【諺】 | A hasty man never wants woe. 【諺】 | Nothing is to be gained by losing your temper.

⇔ 便利

ふあん【不安】
(1)気がかりなこと。 心配なこと。 これから起こる事態に対する恐れから， 気持ちが落ち着かないこと。 また， そのさま。
「～がつのる」「～な一夜を過ごす」
(2)〔哲〕
〔(ドイツ) Angst〕
人間存在の根底にある虚無からくる危機的気分。 原因や対象がわからない点で恐れと異なる。 実存主義など現代哲学の主要概念。
(3)〔心〕 漠とした恐れの感情。 動悸(ドウキ)・発汗などの身体的徴候を伴うことが多い。
﹛派生﹜～が・る（動ラ五［四］）～げ（形動）

ふあん【不安】
〔気がかり･心配〕 uneasiness; uncertainty; anxiety; apprehension; misgivings; unrest; restlessness; 〔どっちつかずの状態〕 suspense; 〔怖れ〕 fear.
～な uneasy; ill at ease; restless; anxious; (宙ぶらりんの) suspenseful; (恐い) fearful.
●不安な感じ a feeling of unrest [restlessness]
・不安な顔 an anxious look
・不安な顔つきをする look anxious [concerned]
・不安な気持ちで with an uneasy [a queasy] conscience
・不安な一夜を明かす pass the night in anxiety; pass an uneasy night
・不安な避難生活を送る lead an uneasy life as a refugee.
●手術には少なからぬ不安があったが, 成功した. I was quite ill at ease over the surgery, but it was successful.
・原発の安全性について住民の不安が大きい. Citizens are very ill at ease concerning the safety of the nuclear power plant.
・昨今の国際情勢を見ると新たな戦争の不安が募る. In light of the recent international situation, anxiety about a new war is intensifying.
・初めてのお産の前には妊婦は不安が高まるものだ. Pregnant women are usually anxious before giving birth for the first time.
・それで彼の深刻な不安が幾分やわらげられるかもしれない. That might alleviate his uneasiness slightly.
・幕が上がると不思議に不安が消えた[去った]. When the curtain rose, surprisingly my anxiety disappeared.
・その計画には一抹の不安が残る. I still have a tinge of uneasiness about that project.
・リストラされるかも知れないという不安が彼の心にうずまいていた. A sense of anxiety that he might be restructured out of his job swirled through his mind.
●不安でたまらない be overcome with apprehensions.
●不安に思う, 不安を感じる feel uneasy [ill at ease] 《about…》; be anxious 《about…》; be uncertain 《over…》; be in suspense
・私は首になりはしないかと不安に思っている. I'm afraid I'll lose my job [be fired].
・何も不安に思うことはないよ. 練習した通りにやればいいんだ. There's nothing to worry about. Just do like you've practiced.
・不安にさせる[陥れる] cause sb uneasiness
・不安になる lose one's peace of mind; grow restless [uneasy]
・絶えず不安におののく be [sit, stand, walk] (up) on thorns
・将来のことを考えると不安に襲われる[駆られる]. When I think about the future, I am seized by anxiety.
・不安に胸をどきどきさせて with palpitating anxiety.
●不安のまったくない above all worry
・不安の念に駆られる be pursued by uneasiness; be attacked by an indefinite inquietude
・不安の影がよぎる throw a shadow of uneasiness; cast a gloom 《on…》
・そう考えると私の心に少なからぬ不安の念が湧き起こった. The thought brought no small uneasiness to my mind.
●不安を抱く entertain some apprehensions 《about…》; be under some uneasiness 《at…》; feel [have] some misgivings 《about…》
・彼のアドバイスで私は不安を払拭することができた. Thanks to his advice I was able to rid myself of uneasiness. | His advice swept away my anxiety.
・世間の人の不安を一掃する drive away a general feeling of unrest
・心の不安を除く free the mind from anxiety
・今回の解決法は根本的なものではなく, 今後に不安を残すものとなった. This method of solution is not a fundamental one and it leaves anxiety for the future.
・最近人々の不安をかきたてるような事件が多い. Recently there have been many incidents that have made people worried.
●結果がどうなるかと絶えず不安であった. I was in constant suspense [anxiety] as to the result.
・不安なんかあるものか. Why should I be anxious?
・コンピューターのことは彼のような専門家に任せておけば少しも不安はない. If we leave the computer matters to a specialist like him there is absolutely nothing for us to worry about.
不安がる be uneasy; be anxious.
●不安がる親をよそに子供たちは冒険の旅に出発した. Leaving behind their anxious parents, the children set out on an adventurous trip.
不安げ uneasiness.
●不安げな表情で with an anxious expression
・不安げに見守る nervously watch over sth.
社会不安 social anxiety.
不安感 a sense of unease; a feeling of uneasiness; 〔特に漠とした〕 malaise.
不安材料 reasons for uneasiness.

じょうしき【常識】
〔common sense〕
(1)ある社会で， 人々の間に広く承認され， 当然もっているはずの知識や判断力。
「～では考えられない奇行」「～に欠ける」
(2)「共通感覚」に同じ。

じょうしき【常識】
common sense [practice]; practical sense [wisdom]; conventional wisdom; mother wit; (実際的な知恵) horse sense; 《口》 gumption; nous; 〔良識〕 good sense; 〔わかりきったこと〕 (a matter of) common knowledge; accepted practice; a long-held belief; a plain fact.
●世間の常識 common practice; what everybody does [thinks]
・社会的常識 normal social behavior; the demands of society
・法律の常識 common sense in law
・政界の常識 common practice among politicians; a common occurrence in politics
・今どきの若者の常識 common knowledge among young people nowadays
・医療に携([sub]たずさ[/sub])わる者の常識 common knowledge for anyone in the medical profession
・健全な常識 robust [sound] common sense.
●常識がある have common sense; be sensible; know what's what [a hawk from a handsaw, one's onions]
・大人でも常識があるとは限らない. Not every adult is (bound to be) sensible.
・常識がない have no common sense
・この国では日本の常識が通じない. What passes for common behavior in Japan does not work here.
●常識からみて from a commonsense standpoint [point of view]; in the name of common sense.
●常識で判断する judge by [from] common sense; apply the standard of common sense
・…は常識でわかる know [realize, tell] from common sense that…
・そんなことは常識でもわかる. Common sense tells you that. | You can work that out from common sense.
・そんなことは常識でわかるはずだ. Common sense ought to tell you that.
・彼女には常識で言って聞かせても無駄だ. Common sense won't work with her.
・常識では考えられない事態だ. That situation goes beyond common sense. | That situation is unthinkable in a commonsensical world.
●このぐらいは常識として心得ておきなさい. That is the basis of what you need to know.
●常識に従う follow common sense
・常識にそむく[反する] defy common sense
・常識になる become common [general] knowledge
・それは今では常識になっている. It is (a matter of) common knowledge now.
・…することは, じきに常識になるだろう. Soon it will not be unusual to do.
・常識に富む be full of common sense; be very sensible; have plenty [a good deal] of sense
・常識にはずれている be eccentric; go against common sense
・常識に欠ける lack common sense
・あれは常識に欠ける行動だった. I lacked common sense when I did that. | That was something that I wouldn't normally do [have done].
・常識にとらわれる[縛られる] be fettered [bound, restrained] by common sense
・常識にとらわれず自由に freely without being fettered by common sense
・常識に照らして考える[判断する] think [judge] on the basis of common sense.
●常識のない lacking common sense [⇒ひじょうしき]
・常識のある人 a person of [with] common sense; a sensible person
・常識の通じない人 a person who doesn't understand common sense
・常識の範囲で within (the bounds of) common sense; within sensible limits.
●常識をわきまえる discern common sense; have sufficient common sense 《to do》
・常識を欠く lack [have no] common sense
・常識をひどく欠いた 《a person》 woefully lacking in common sense
・常識を働かせる exercise one's common sense
・常識をちょっと働かせればすぐわかるだろう. Exercising a little common sense will help you to realize it right away.
・君の行動は常識をはずれている. Your actions are not in accordance with common sense.
・常識を疑う doubt sb's common sense
・子供にあんなことを許すなんて親の常識を疑うね. Letting their children do that makes me doubt their common sense as parents.
・常識を超える[打ち破る] go beyond [break the bounds of] common practice
・それまでの常識を超えた高性能 a high capability exceeding what has previously been the norm
・常識を覆す[ひっくり返す] overturn [turn upside down] accepted ideas [long-held beliefs, conventional wisdom]
・その発見は天文学の常識を覆す出来事だった. That discovery was an event that overturned the accepted ideas of astronomy.
●「くわしいんだね」「こんなの常識だよ」 “You know all about it, don't you?”―“That is a matter of common knowledge. | Everybody knows that.”
・型破りな男だが結構常識はある. He's no ordinary man, but even so he is pretty sensible.
・常識一点張りだ. He thinks common sense is everything. | Common sense is everything to him.
・今や女子高校生の化粧は常識だ. Now it's quite common [not unusual] for high-school girls to wear makeup.
一般常識 common knowledge; what everybody knows.
常識人[家] 〔良識ある人〕 a commonsense person; a person of [who has] common sense.
常識的 ⇒じょうしきてき.
常識テスト a test of general knowledge; a general-knowledge test.
常識哲学 commonsense philosophy.
常識外れ a lack of common sense; insensitivity; eccentricity.
●オペラの途中で携帯の着信音が鳴ったのはちょっと常識外れだったね. Letting your mobile phone go off during the opera showed rather a lack of common sense, didn't it?
常識判断 commonsense judgment.
常識問題 〔専門的でない一般的知識を問う問題〕 problems testing general knowledge.

I じ【次】
助数詞。 回数・順序などを表す。
「第一～探検隊」

II すき【主基・次】
〔「つぎ（次）」の意〕
大嘗祭(ダイジヨウサイ)のとき， 神事に用いる新穀を捧げる国郡。 悠紀(ユキ)とともに卜定(ボクジヨウ)によって選ばれる。 主基の国。
→ 悠紀

III つぎ【次】
(1)あとにすぐ続くこと。 また， そのもの。
「～の機会にする」「～から～へと仕事を変える」「～はだれだ」
(2)位置・場所のすぐ続いていること。
「～の間」
(3)あるものより一段低い地位。 すぐ下の順位。
「部長の～の人」
(4)宿(シユク)。 宿駅。 うまや。
「東海道五十三～」

Iじ【次】
1 〔順序〕 order; sequence; 【数】 degree.
●一[二, 三]次 ⇒いちじ2, にじ2, さんじ1
・一次[二次]コイル[電池] 【電】 a primary [secondary] coil [battery]
・二次試験は面接による. The second examination is by interview.
・二次の発表 a second announcement
・第二次吉田内閣 the second Yoshida Cabinet
・第 43次南極観測隊 the forty-third [43rd] Antarctic expedition
・n 次式 a polynomial of degree n [n degree]; a polynomial of the nth degree; an nth degree polynomial
・x について 2 次である be of the second degree in x.
2 〔次の〕 (the) next; the following; this [these]; below; 〔下位〕 sub-.
●次回 (the) next time. [⇒じかい3]
IIつぎ【次】
1 〔後続〕
●1 つ置いて次 the one after (the) next; the next but one.
●今回は失敗したが次があるさ. You failed this time, but your day will come. | If at first you don't succeed, try, try again. 【諺】
・明治の次が大正, その次が昭和である. After Meiji comes Taishō, and after that Shōwa.
・今度の電車は立川行き, 次が高尾行き, その次が青梅行きです. This train is for Tachikawa, the next one is for Takao, and the one after that is for Ōme.
●この次から beginning [(starting) from] next time; 〔将来〕 in (the) future; hereafter
・次から次へと one after the other [another]; in succession [turn]; in sequence
・きょうは次から次へと客があった. We had a constant stream of visitors today.
・近ごろは次から次へと奇妙な事件が持ち上がる. Lately it's just been one strange incident after another.
●次に next; (and) then; after…; 《文》 subsequently
・次にこの計画に必要な経費のことを考えなければならない. We have to think next about the expenses required by this project.
・次々に ⇒つぎつぎ
・その次になすべきこと the next thing one must do; one's next step
・この次に next [another] time
・それはまたこの次にしよう. Let's leave [save] that for another time.
・次に近畿地方の天気予報をお伝えします. Now the weather forecast for the Kinki area.
・子供は最初にかなを覚え, 次に漢字を覚える. Children learn kana first and then kanji.
・次女の次に長男が生まれた. Our oldest son was born after our second daughter.
・次に来たのは彼です. He was the next (one) to arrive.
・前菜の次に魚(の料理)が出た. The hors d'oeuvres were followed by fish.
・その次に会ったとき彼女は髪を長く伸ばしていた. The next time I saw her, she had let her hair grow long.
・次にお待ちのお客様, こちらの席へどうぞ. Would the next person [whoever is next] please take a seat here?
●次の next; following; ensuing; coming; 〔隣の〕 adjoining
・次の日 the next [following] day; the day after
・次の夏 the next [following] summer
・次の機会 the next opportunity
・次の世代 the next [coming] generation
・この次の電車 the train after this; the next train
・(その)次の日曜 (the) next Sunday
・この次の次の日曜 《on》 the Sunday after next
・次の次の駅 the station after the next (one)
・次の角を左に曲がる turn left at the next corner
・次のとおり 《be》 as follows
・大臣の発言は次のとおり. The minister's statement was as follows.
・次の方どうぞ. Next, please.
・その日も, 次の日も, また次の日も雨は降らなかった. It did not rain that day or the next or the day after that.
・火曜日に出張だ, この次の火曜日なんだがね. I am going out on business on Tuesday―I mean, this coming Tuesday.
・参会者には次の顔ぶれがあった. Among those present were the following.
・次の文を読んで問いに答えよ. Read the following passage and answer the questions.
●次は何[だれ]かな. What's [Who's] next? | What [Who] comes next?
・次は荒木さんのピアノ演奏です. Next on our program is Miss Araki playing the piano.
・卒業したら次は就職だ. After you graduate you have to get a job.
・次は君たち若者の時代だ. The time for young people like you is coming next. | Soon it will be your turn.
・さて次はシドニーからのニュースです. Now for the news from Sydney.
・〔車掌が〕 次は神戸です. The next (station) stop is Kōbe. | Kōbe is the next stop.
・この実験に次はない. This test is given only once. | You have only one chance on this test.
・〔順番が〕 いよいよ次だ. Finally I'm next.
2 〔次席の位〕 next 《after…》; 《in》 second place 《after…》.
●(地位が)…の次にくる be second to…; rank next [second] to…
・ミルトンはシェイクスピアの次に置かれる. Milton is ranked after [just below] Shakespeare.
・大阪は東京の次に人口が多い. Osaka is second after Tokyo in population.
●社長の次の地位 the position immediately below [next in line after] the president
・次の間 ⇒つぎのま.
3 〔宿場〕 a post town; a station; a stage.
●東海道五十三次 the 53 stages on the Tōkaidō.

いし【意思】
(1)心の中に思い浮かべる， 何かをしようという考え。 思い。
「撤回する～はない」
(2)〔法〕（ア）民法上， 欲求ないし承認。 表示行為の直接の原因としての心理作用。 （イ）刑法上， 自分の為(ナ)そうとする行為についての認識。

いし【意思】
an intention; an intent; a wish; a purpose; a mind 《to do》.
●自分が脳死になったとき, あなたはあなたの臓器を提供する意思がありますかありませんか. Do you wish, or not wish [Is it your wish, or not], to donate your organs in the case of brain death [if you are declared brain-dead]?
・意思があって 〔故意に〕 on purpose; purposely; intentionally
・彼は横領の意思があって会社の金を持ち出したのか. Did he take the company's money with the intention of embezzling it?
・外国語で意思が通じたときの感激 the thrill of making yourself understood in a foreign language
・スタッフの意思が通じ合わなければいい映画は作れない. If the staff don't understand each other [communicate properly, see eye to eye], we can't make a good film.
・自国の利益を第一に考えたい意思が働くのは当然だ. It's only natural that the desire to think first of the benefit to one's own country should come into play.
●国民投票は国民が重要な政策を自らの意思で決定するものである. A referendum is a means for citizens to decide on important policies through an expression of their own wishes.
●人の意思にそむいて against sb's wishes
・生前の彼女の意思により, 移植のための角膜の摘出手術が行われた. According to her wishes before her death, an operation was performed to remove her corneas for transplanting.
・投票は個人の自由な意思に基づいてなされるべきだ. Voting should be carried out on the basis of the [each] individual's free will.
●意思の欠缺([sub]けんけつ[/sub]) lack of intent
・意思の疎通 (mutual) understanding; (reciprocal) communication
・親子の間で意思の疎通がないと, 子供は非行に走りがちだ. Without mutual understanding (of each other's intentions) between parents and children, the children will be prone to misbehavior.

●君は彼女に危害を加えんとの意思をもって彼女の家を訪れたのか. Did you visit her home with intent to harm her?

・政府はその国の大使に核実験反対の意思を伝えた. The government informed that country's ambassador of its opposition to nuclear testing.
・英語で自分の意思を伝えられるようになるのに僕は半年かかった. It took me six months to be able to express myself [say what I wanted (to say)] in English.
・私たちは身振りで周囲の人と意思を疎通させることができた. By using gestures, we were able to make ourselves understood to [communicate with] people around us.
・彼は社長の説得にもかかわらず退社の意思を変えなかった. Despite the boss's attempts to dissuade him, he didn't change his mind about leaving [alter his decision to resign].
・市長は議会の意思を尊重すると言った. The Mayor said that he would respect the wishes of the Assembly [Council].
・言葉は意思を伝達する重要な手段である. Language is an important means of communicating our intentions.
・それについての地区住民の意思を問う住民投票が行われた. A referendum was held to find out the opinions of local people on the matter.
・本人の意思を確認した上で申し込みの手続きをしてください. Please complete the application formalities after ascertaining [confirming] the applicant's own wishes [intentions].
●父は私を医者にする意思だった. My father wanted [intended] me to be a doctor.
・面談の意思はない. I have no intention of talking (with them). | No talks [interviews].

●意思能力がない be lacking [devoid of] mental capacity.

みせる【見せる】
(1)人に見させる。 示して見えるようにする。
「掛軸を～・せる」「庭を～・せてもらう」「手のうちを～・せる」
(2)おもてに表し出す。
「疲れを～・せる」「誠意を～・せる」
(3)こうむらせる。 よくわからせる。
「憂き目を～・せる」「目にもの～・せる」
(4)それらしく見えるようにする。
「若く～・せる」「長身に～・せる」
(5)診察させる。
「医者に～・せる」
(6)（女を男に）結婚させる。 めあわせる。
「親王達にこそは～・せ奉らめ/源氏（若菜下）」
(7)（補助動詞）
動詞の連用形に助詞「て」を添えた形に付いて用いられる。 （ア）ある動作を人に見えるようにわざわざする意を表す。
「絵に描いて～・せる」「大げさに驚いて～・せる」（イ）話し手の強い意志を表す。 「来年の今月今夜になつたならば， 僕の涙で必ず月は曇らして～・せるから/金色夜叉（紅葉）」
︱慣用︱ 後ろを～・白い歯を～・泣きを～・目に物～

みせる【見せる】
1 〔提示する〕 show; (差し出す) submit.
●身分証明書を見せる show one's ID card
・カタログを見せて説明する show the catalog and give an explanation.
●運転免許証を見せてください. Show me your driver's license.
・この手紙は君には見せられない. I can't show you this letter.
・これはまだだれにも見せたことのない私の日記だ. This is my diary, which I have never shown to anyone.
2 〔相手の前に出る〕 appear; show oneself.
●着物姿を見せたがる want to show oneself dressed in a kimono
・両親に子供を見せに帰郷する go back home to show one's child to one's parents.
●彼は 10 日ぶりに姿を見せた. After ten days he showed himself.
・彼女は遠方の親戚に顔を見せに行った. She went off to see distant relatives.
・全焼した家屋は無惨な姿を見せていた. The burned out house presented a grim sight.
3 〔目に触れさせる〕 show; (露出する) expose; 〔可視化する〕 make visible.
●かばんを開けて中を見せる open a suitcase and show what is inside
・マスクを外して顔を見せる remove one's gauze mask and show one's face
・歯を見せて笑う show one's teeth as one laughs
・下着を見せるファッション the vogue for exposing one's underwear
・ミクロの世界を映像にして見せる make a micro world visible in an image
・複雑な経済の動きを図にして見せる illustrate a complex economic trend in a diagram.
●ヘビはちらちらと舌を見せた. The snake flicked out its tongue.
・傷口を見せてごらん. Show me your cut.
・カーテンを開けて患者に外の景色を見せた. We opened the curtains to give the patient a view of the world outside.
・もっとよく見せてくれ. Let me have a better look at it.
4 〔表に現す〕 make apparent; (隠せなくて) get [come] out.
●衰えを見せる show one's age
・疲れを見せる show one's fatigue
・安堵の表情を見せる show one's reassurance in one's expression
・悔しそうな様子を見せる let one's regret show.
●病人はようやく食欲を見せた. The patient at last showed an appetite.
・景気が回復の兆しを見せ始めた. The economy has begun to show signs of a recovery.
・事態は意外な展開を見せた. Events showed an unexpected development.
・首相は法案の成立に自信を見せた. The Prime Minister showed his confidence in the bill's passage.
・奴はとうとう詐欺師の正体を見せた. In the end he showed himself as the fraud he was.
・今年のメーデーは近年にない盛り上がりを見せた. May Day this year showed an excitement not seen in recent years.
5 〔披露する･見せつける〕 show.
●試合を見せる put on a match
・好意的な態度を見せる show a receptive attitude
・家族の前で踊って見せる perform a dance before one's family
・黒板上で方程式を解いて見せる show how to solve the equation on the blackboard.
●今度こそ勝って見せる. This time I'll show you I can win.
・彼女は顔だけは笑ってみせた. Her face alone showed a smile.
・息子に草笛を吹いてみせた. He showed his son how to make a whistle with a blade of grass.
・どれ, ひとつ歌ってみせよう. Okay, I'll sing you a song.
・「私ならもっとうまくできる」「じゃあ見せてもらおうか」 “I can do better.”―“Show me.”
・彼がこうして立派に働いているところを両親に見せたい. I wish his parents could see what a hard worker he is.
・この金メダルを天国の母に見せたかった. I wish my mother could have seen this gold medal.
・あいつには痛い目を見せてやる. I'll show him what pain is.
・このたびは地獄を見せられた. This time I went to hell and back.
・待て! 今日こそは目にもの見せてくれる. Hold it! You're going to get yours today.
6 〔装う〕 present an appearance of…; look.
●大人っぽく見せる look mature (for one's age)
・幸せそうに見せる look happy
・足を長く見せるデザイン a design that makes one's legs appear [look] longer
・料理をおいしそうに見せる盛りつけ dressing of food on a platter that makes it look delicious
・事故に見せて人を襲う attack sb and make it look like an accident.
●「元気そうですね」「そう見せているだけです」 “You look well.”―“I just make it seem so.”
・赤いドレスは彼女を一段と美しく見せた. Her red dress made her seem all the more beautiful.
・あのあごひげが彼を精悍に見せている. His goatee gives him a ferocious look.
7 〔診察や鑑定をしてもらう〕 have something looked at.
●病気[傷]を見せる have one's illness [cut] looked at
・骨董([sub]こっとう[/sub])を専門家に見せる have an antique looked at by a specialist.
●まだ医者に見せていないのか. Haven't you had a specialist look at it yet?
8 〔見る価値がある〕 make sth worth watching.
●〔プロ選手などが〕見せるプレーを心がける concentrate on making a good play
・見せる試合をする play a riveting game.
●彼女の演技はなかなか見せる. Her performances are something to see.

1 〔拒絶する〕 refuse 《a bribe, an office, a gift》; reject; turn down; 《米》 throw sb down; 〔辞退する〕 decline 《an invitation》; turn down; refuse; say no; excuse oneself; ask to be excused 《from attending》.
●縁談を断る turn down [decline, refuse] an offer to be introduced to somebody [a possible marriage partner]
・借金の依頼を断る refuse [turn down] a request for a loan; refuse to lend sb money

・申し出を断る reject [turn down] an offer [a suggestion, a proposal]

・注文を断る decline (to fulfill) an order; do not accept an order
・にべもなく断る refuse flatly; decline outright; say an outright no; give [make] a curt refusal
・彼女からの依頼であれば無下に断るわけにもいかない. (In her case) I can't just refuse her request outright. | I cannot just flatly turn her down.
●忙しくて行かれないと断ってください. Tell them that I'm too busy to go.
・会いたくないと言って断ってください. Tell them [Say] that I don't want to see them.
・女性に頼まれると断りにくいね. It's difficult to refuse a lady.
・どうしても断りきれなかった. I just couldn't (bring myself to) refuse. | I simply had to accept.

2 〔事前に通告する〕 give sb notice [warning]; warn 《sb》; tell 《sb》 (in advance); 〔了解を得る〕 ask (for) permission; ask sb (in advance); get permission; ask sb's permission [leave].
●断らずに 〔予告せずに〕 without (previous) notice; without (advance) warning; without saying 《so》 in advance [beforehand]; 〔了解なく〕 without permission [leave]
・断らずに外出する go out without (asking [getting, obtaining]) permission; 〔知らせずに〕 go out without telling 《one's parents》.
●はっきり断っておくが, これは私専用だ. I want to [Let me] make this absolutely [crystal] clear. Nobody is to use this except me. | Let's be clear about this. I am the only person who can use this.
・ひとこと断っておくが…. I'd like you to remember that…. | May I remind you that…? | Please remember [don't forget]….
・明日の予定の変更は電話で断っておいた. I phoned to warn her about the change in tomorrow's plans.
・だれに断ってそんなことをしたのか. Who gave you permission to [said you could] do that?
・だれかに断りましたか. Have you got permission?

おもいつく【思い付く】
think of…; hit upon…; take [get] it into one's head 《to do, that…》; 〈事が主語〉 come to mind; cross [enter] one's mind; occur to one; strike one; dawn upon one. [＝かんがえつく]
●思いつくまま as the impulse [urge] takes one; 《口》 off the top of one's head [mind]
・思いつくままに好きな作家の名前を挙げてごらん. Tell me the names of your favorite writers as they come [occur] to you.
・この日記は日々のことを思いつくままに書いたものです. In this diary, I have written about everyday things just as they occurred to me [《口》 off the top of my head].
●いいことを思いついた. I('ve) had [hit upon] a good idea. | A good idea has occurred [come] to me. | I know (what)!
・盗難防止の新しい方法を思いついた. We hit on [dreamed up, came up with] a novel way of preventing burglaries.
・私は久しぶりに旧友を訪ねようと思いついた. It occurred to me to call on an old friend I hadn't seen for years.
・ちょっと思いついたんだけれど, しょうゆの代わりにみそを使ってはどうでしょうか. It's just occurred to me, but how about using miso instead of soy sauce? | I know (what)! Why not use miso instead of soy sauce?
・今思いつくことといえば, 彼に援助を求めることぐらいのものだ. The only thing I can think of offhand is to ask for his help.
・対策として思いつくのは窓に網ガラスを入れることぐらいです. As a countermeasure, all I can think of [The only countermeasure that suggests itself] is to put wire glass in the windows.
・何からその考えを思いついたのですか. How did you come to think of that? | What suggested that idea to you? | What put that idea into your head?
・何か思いついたことがあったらおっしゃってください. If anything occurs to you, please say so [let us know]. | Please feel free to make any comments that may occur to you.
・ふと思いついて出かけてきたけれど, もう梅は散っているし, 桜はまだだし, つまらなかった. I went out on a sudden whim, but the plum blossoms had finished, and the cherry blossoms weren't out yet, so it wasn't much fun.
・後から思いついて彼の名前も招待客の名簿に加えることにした. His name was added to the guest list as [on] an afterthought.
・だれも彼に相談することを思いつかなかった. No one thought of consulting [to consult] (with) him. | It didn't occur to anyone to consult (with) him.
・普通の人が思いつかないようなことを彼女は発想する. She can conceive of things that ordinary people would never think of [that would never occur to ordinary people].

・童心に返る return [revert] to the innocence of childhood
・正気に返る return [revert, be restored] to sanity [one's senses]
・二度と返らない青春の日々 the days of one's youth that will never return [recur].
●年を取ると子供に返る. As one gets older, one becomes a child again [reverts to one's childhood].
・子供に返りたいものだ. I wish I were [could go back to being] a child again!
・いい球が返ってきました. 〔球技で〕 A good ball was returned.
・夏休みが終わって日常の暮らしが返ってきた. After the summer vacation ordinary daily life was resumed [life returned to normal].
・元の話に返るけど, それから彼は東京に出た. To return to what I was talking about, then he left for Tokyo.
・自然に返れ. Back to nature!
・基本に返れ. Back to basics!
・悔んでも返らぬことだ. Feeling sorry won't bring it back. | It's no good [use] crying over spilt milk. | What is done cannot be undone.
・青春は去ってふたたび返らず. Youth is gone beyond recall [never to return].

3 【返る】 〔元の所有者に戻る〕 return; be returned; come back.
●遺失物は持ち主へ返った. The lost article was returned to its owner.
・財産は元の持ち主の手に返った. The property reverted to the original owner.
・貸した金は全部返った. All the loans were repaid [paid back].
・人間ドックの検査結果が返ってきた. The results of my medical checkup have come.
・宛先不明で手紙が返ってきた. The letter was returned address unknown.
・返ってきたアンケート用紙を数えた. I counted the questionnaires that were returned.

4 【返る】 〔働きかけに反応する〕 react; rebound; resound.
●こだまが返ってきた. An echo resounded (back).
・反応が返ってきた. A reaction occurred [was received].
●同じ言葉が返ってきた. The same words were repeated [reply was received, answer came again].
・思わぬ答えが返ってきた. An unexpected answer (was) returned.
・返事が返ってこない. No reply has been received.

III かえる【変える】

1 〔状態を変化させる〕 change; alter; shift; convert; transform; vary; reverse 《positions》; 【音楽】 〔高度･音声を〕 modulate.
●態度を変える change one's attitude
・速さ[高さ, 向き, 振動数]を変える change speed [height, direction, pitch]
・条件を変える revise the conditions
・フォームを変える change one's form
・髪形を変える change one's hairstyle
・現状を変える alter the (current) circumstances; change [alter] the status quo
・調子を変えて歌う sing in another key
・水力を電力に変える convert water power into electricity
・愛を憎しみに変える turn love (in)to hate
・脂肪をエネルギーに変える convert fat into energy
・温度を 10 度から 20 度に変える change the temperature from 10 degrees to 20 degrees
・染め変える re-dye
・顔色を変えた. His face changed color.
●洪水は川の流れを変える. Floods turn rivers out of their course.
・その事件は私の人生を変えた. That event changed my life.
・電気の発明は私たちの暮らしを変えた. The discovery of electricity changed our lives [way of life].
・プライバシー保護のため音声を変えて放送しています. The voice has been altered in this broadcast to protect the speaker's privacy.
・夫婦喧嘩は形を変えた愛情表現であることもある. Fights between husband and wife may be a transmuted expression of affection.
・サボテンのとげは葉が姿を変えたものである. The thorns of a cactus are transmuted forms of leaves.
・若い力で世の中を変えよう. Change [Transform] the world with the power of youth!
・彼らの姿は豚に変えられた. They were turned from men into pigs.
・この座いすは角度が 5 段階に変えられます. This armchair can be adjusted to five graded positions.
・カメレオンは自由に体の色を変えることができるのだろうか. I wonder if a chameleon really can change color as it pleases.
・この形状記憶合金でできているスプーンは, 障害者が自分で使いやすいように形を変えることができる. This shape memory alloy spoon can be adjusted to a shape easy for a handicapped person to use.

2 〔改める･変更する〕 reform; revise; remold; amend.
●見方を変える revise one's opinion
・主義を変える change one's principle(s)
・主義を変えない abide by [stick to] one's principle(s)
・予定[計画]を変える revise a schedule [plan]
・教育方針を変える reform an educational policy
・名前を変える change one's name
・話題を変える change the subject
・趣向を変える try something else for a change
・位置[針路]を変える alter (one's) position [course]
・席を変える change seats [places] 《with sb》
・河岸([sub]かし[/sub])を変える change the venue; move on somewhere else for another drink
・計画を作り変える revise a plan.
●いったん委員会を通った決定は変えるわけにいかない. Once a decision has passed the committee, it cannot be altered [must stand].
・雨なので会場を屋外から体育館に変えた. Rain forced us to move the venue from the open air to the gymnasium.
・その銀行は制服の色を紺から茶に変えた. The bank changed the color of its uniforms from dark blue to brown.
・志望校を変えるなら今のうちだ. If you want to apply to a different school, now's the time.
・今度は方面を変えて伊豆へ行こう. For [By way of] a change, let's go to Izu.
・帰路はコースを変えてシベリア経由とすることもできる. The journey can be varied by returning via Siberia.
・日を変えて訪問することにしよう. Let's visit her (again) some other time [day].
・薬を変えて, 少し様子を見ましょう. 〔医者の言葉〕 Let's try a different medicine and see what happens.
・この料理は牛肉を豚肉に変えてもおいしいですよ. This dish tastes good if you replace the beef with pork, too.
・僕たちはいつものやり方を変えることにした. We decided to depart from our usual method.
・習慣だから変えられないということもある. Sometimes you can't change something, because it's a custom.
・最後まで目標を変えるな. Keep [Stick] to your purpose.

IV かえる【帰る】

1 〔元の場所に戻る〕 return; come [go, get, be] home [back]; turn back.
●家に帰る come [go] (back) home
・故郷に帰る go back to one's home town; return to (the place) where one was born [grew up]
・東京[畑, 職場]から帰る come back from Tokyo [the fields, one's workplace]
・仕事[練習, 旅行]から帰る come back from work [training, a trip]
・腹をすかして[くたびれて]帰る come home hungry [tired]
・持って[連れて]帰る, 持ち[連れ]帰る bring sth [sb] home
・泣いて帰る, 泣き帰る come home crying [in tears]
・走って帰る run home
・飛んで帰る hurry [rush, fly] home
・まっすぐ帰る go straight home
・手ぶらで帰る return empty-handed
・電車[タクシー]で帰る go home by train [taxi]
・帰る途中 〔道すがら〕 on the way home [back].
●お帰りなさい. ⇒おかえりなさい.
・今帰ったよ. ＝ただいま 4.
・早く帰ってくるんだよ. Don't be long. | Come back soon. | Make sure you come back early.
・父危篤すぐ帰れ. 〔電報で〕 Father sick return soonest.
・6 時に帰ります. I'll be back at six.
・すぐ帰ってくるからね. I won't be long. | I'll be back soon.
・彼はとうとう帰ってきた. He is home [has returned] at last.
・そろそろ船が帰ってくるころだ. The ship should be back soon.
・帰ってきたら手を洗う習慣をつけなさい. Get into the habit of washing your hands when you come home.
・父は会社から帰るなり「転勤だ」と言った. As soon as my father got home, he said, “I've been transferred.” | No sooner had my father come home from work, than he announced that he'd been transferred.
・三塁走者が帰って 1 点追加しました. 〔野球で〕 The third-base runner came in to score another run.
・帰ってもだれもいないから, 淋しくて. I've come home to find no one in, so I feel very lonely.
・生きて帰ったものわずかに 3 人. Only three of them returned alive.
・私は帰るところがない. I have nowhere to go home to.
・帰る道がわからない. I can't find my way back.
・帰りなんいざ. I will arise and I will go now.
・私たちは今夜東京に帰らなければならない. 〔到着していなければならない〕 We have to be back in Tokyo tonight. | 〔出発しなければならない〕 We have to leave for Tokyo tonight.
・あの人はもう帰ってこない. He won't be back. | He is gone for good.
・彼は行ったきり帰ってこない. He went away and hasn't returned.
・いくら泣いたって死んだお父さんは帰ってこない. No amount of crying will bring your father back (to life again).
・子狐はちゃんと母狐のもとへ帰れただろうか. I wonder if the baby fox got back to its mother all right.
・台風で飛行機が欠航し, 帰れなくなった. With the flight cancelled by the typhoon, I couldn't get back home.

2 〔去る〕 go back; leave; take one's leave; be off.
●とっとと帰れ. Get out (of here)! | Now be off!
・君はもう帰ってよろしい. You can go [leave] now. | That's all, so off you go. | 〔用済み〕 You are dismissed.
・いくら頼んでも無駄だ. もういい加減に帰りなさい. It's no use asking. Just (give up and) leave.
・お先に帰ります. (I hope you don't mind, but) I'll be off now.
・一緒に帰りましょう. Let's leave together.
・(私に)黙って帰るとはけしからん. How dare he leave without telling me!
・すみませんが今日はこのままお帰りください. I am sorry but I'll have to ask you to leave now (and come back another time).
・来客は一人また一人と帰っていった. The guests went away one after the other. | The company dropped away.
・ツバメが南の国へ帰っていった. The swallows flew off south.
・もう帰らなければなりません. I must be going [leaving]. | It's time I was going [for me to go].
・私たちは帰っていく彼の後ろ姿を見送った. We watched his retreating figure.
・実家に帰らせていただきます. I shall take my leave and return to my family. | I want a divorce.
・彼女は怒って帰ってしまった. She walked out in anger.
・試合の途中で帰る客は一人もいなかった. Not a single spectator walked out during the match.
・これは君が帰った後で決定したことなんだ. This is something we decided after you had left.
・私たちは 3 時で帰らされた. We were told to go home at three.

V かえる【換える･替える･代える】

1 【換える･替える】 〔別の物と交換する〕 (転換する) change [convert, turn] 《sth into…》; (交換する) exchange [barter] 《sth for…》.
●商売を替える change one's business
・仕事を替える change [move, shift] jobs
・所属を替える change one's affiliation; 〔政治家が〕 join another party
・医者を替える change one's doctor; change doctors; consult another doctor
・手を替え品を替え相手を説得したが無駄だった. Try as I might [No matter how I put it], I couldn't convince her.
・チャンネルを換える change the channel; change [switch] channels
・小切手[トラベラーズチェック]を現金に換える convert a check [traveler's check] into cash; exchange a check [traveler's check] for cash; cash a traveler's check
・時計を金に換える exchange [swap] a watch for (some) money; pawn a watch
・千円札を百円玉に換える change [break] a \1,000 《米》 bill [《英》 note] into \100 coins
・ドルを円に換える convert dollars into yen; exchange dollars for yen
・背に腹は換えられない. ⇒せ1 1
・乗り換える change (buses, trains, planes)
・書き換える rewrite
・(絵を)掛け替える rehang.
●陳列の美術品は一年に何回か替えます. Exhibits are changed [replaced] several times a year.
・彼は任期中に秘書を 3 人替えた. While he was in office, he replaced three secretaries.
・〔乗り捨てられた車を発見〕 犯人はここで車を換えて逃走したらしい. It looks as if the criminal switched cars and made off here.
・彼は言葉を換えて説明した. He explained in other words.
・彼は銃をペンに換えて戦った. He substituted a pen for his gun, and fought on.
・お米を換えたでしょ. ご飯の味が違うわ. You've bought another kind of rice, haven't you? This tastes different.
・何かほかの品と換えてはいけませんか. Could I exchange this for something else?
・これをあなたのと換えていただけませんか. Will you swap this for yours?
・まごころは金銭には換えられない. You can't buy kindness.
・命は金([sub]かね[/sub])には換えられない. Life cannot be bartered for gold.

2 【換える･替える･代える】 〔新しいのと交換する･取り替える〕 substitute 《sth for…》; put [use] sth in place of…; replace 《sth with…》; 〔お代わりをする〕 renew; repeat.
●換え時 ⇒かえどき
・花瓶の水を替える change [replace] the water in a flower vase
・気分を替える put oneself in a different mood; divert oneself
・畳の表を替える replace the covers of old tatami mats (with new ones); re-cover old tatami mats
・(カッターの)刃を替える change [replace] a blade
・おむつを替える change a diaper; change (a baby's) diapers
・電池[電球]を替える change [replace] a battery [light bulb]
・井戸を替える clean a well [⇒さらう1]
・新しいのに替える change sth for a new one; replace sth with a new one
・水槽の水は換えたばかりだ. I've just changed the water in the tub. | I've just put new water in the tub.
・入れ換える renew; replace; substitute; put in afresh
・付け換える renew; replace; substitute; put on afresh
・買い換える buy a new one.
●注射針は使うたびに換えます. The needle is replaced after every use.
・電灯を換えたら部屋が明るくなった. When we changed [replaced] the tube, the room became lighter.
・そろそろこの歯ブラシは換えたほうがいい. I ought to change this toothbrush. | It's time I got a new toothbrush.

3 【代える】 〔代わりとする･代用する〕 substitute [stand in] 《for…》; 〔ひきかえにする〕 act [serve] as….
●ピッチャーを替える change the pitcher [pitchers]; send in a substitute pitcher
・担当者を替える replace the person in charge; put another person in charge
・命に代えて使命を全うします. I will stake my life on completing my mission.
・書面をもって挨拶に代える write a letter instead of paying a personal visit.
●これをもってお祝いの言葉に代えさせていただきます. Please accept this (modest) speech as an expression of my congratulations. | Sincere congratulations, and thank you for listening.
・レポート提出をもって期末試験に代えることができる. An essay may be substituted for an end-of-term exam.
・賞品の発送をもって発表に代えさせていただきます. Prizes will be sent to the winners. No other notification will be made.
・〔チーム競技で〕 監督はけがをした田中に代えて鈴木を入れた. The manager replaced the injured Tanaka with Suzuki [sent Suzuki in (to play) instead of the injured Tanaka, substituted Suzuki for the injured Tanaka].
・神様, 私の命に代えてもこの子を助けてください. Oh God, please save this child, even at the cost of my own life.
・〔身の代金を要求されて〕 子供の命には代えられない. Nothing can replace the life of my child.
・それは何物にも代えがたいほど大切なものだ. It is so important to me (that) nothing could replace it [it is worth more than anything (in the world)].
・健康は何物にも代えがたい. Nothing can take the place of health. | Health is everything.

VI かえる【孵る】
〔卵が〕 be hatched; hatch (out).
●サケは卵からかえる. Salmon are hatched [hatch out] from eggs.
・卵からかえったばかりのひな a newly [freshly] hatched chick.
●ひながかえった. A chick (has, has been, was) hatched (out).
・12 個のニワトリの卵のうち 10 個かえった. Ten (out) of the twelve hen's eggs hatched. | Ten chickens hatched out of the twelve eggs.

.

I ほん【本】
※一※ （名）
※一※
(1)書物。 書籍。
「～を読む」「漫画の～」「書いたものを一冊の～にまとめる」
(2)脚本。 台本。
「キャストより， ～のよしあしが問題だ」
※二※
(1)もとになるもの。 もとのもの。
「物語・集など書き写すに～に墨つけぬ/枕草子 75」
(2)てほん。 模範。
「これをこそ今生にさとりをひらく～とはまうし候へ/歎異抄」
(3)基本。 根本。
「人は正直を～とする事， 是神国のならはせなり/浮世草子・永代蔵 4」
(4)本当であること。
「徳様は何やら訳(ワケ)の悪いこと有て， たんとぶたれさんしたと聞たが， ～か/浄瑠璃・曾根崎心中」
※二※ （接頭）
名詞に付く。
(1)いま現に問題にしているもの， 当面のものである意を表す。
「～席」「～事件」
(2)それが話している自分にかかわるものであることを表す。
「～大臣」
※三※ （接尾）
助数詞。
(1)細長い物の数を数えるのに用いる。
「一～杉」「棒が三～」「牛乳五～」
(2)剣道・柔道などで， 技(ワザ)の数を数えるのに用いる。
「三～勝負」「一～とる」
〔「さんぼん」「いっぽん」などのように， 撥音に続くときは濁音に， 促音に続くときは半濁音になる〕

II もと【本・元】
※一※ （名）
(1)（多く「元」と書く）物事が生ずるはじめの物や所。 ことのおこり。 はじめ。
「～へさかのぼって考え直す」「火の～」「出版～」
(2)物事の根本をなすところ。 根幹。 基礎。 土台。 ⇔ 末。 《本》「～が枯れる」「農は国の～」「資料を～にして議論する」
〔基礎の意では「基」とも書く〕
(3)（「因」とも書く）原因。 理由。
「失敗は成功の～」「けんかの～はささいなことだった」「間違いの～」
(4)（「素」とも書く）原料。 材料。 《元》「大豆を～にして作る」「～を仕込む」
(5)
もとで。 もとね。 元金。 原価。 《元》「～を取る」「～を割る」「～がかかる」
(6)草木の株または幹。
(7)和歌の上の句。
⇔ 末
「歌どもの～をおほせられて， 『これが末いかに』と問はせ給ふに/枕草子23」
※二※ （接尾）
助数詞。
(1)草木の株の数を数えるのに用いる。 ほん。 《本》「菊一～を植える」
(2)鷹狩りに使う鷹の数を数えるのに用いる。 羽(ワ)。
「鷹一～」
～が切・れる
売り値が仕入れ価格より安くなる。 もとが割れる。
～が取・れる
(1)商売で， 元手が回収できる。
(2)転じて， はらった努力に応じた報いを手に入れることができる。
～はと言えば
ある出来事の原因やきっかけを考えると。
「～， 君のせいだ」
～も子もな・い
〔「元」は元金， 「子」は利息の意〕
利益ばかりか元手まで失う。 何もかもすっかりなくす。
～を正(タダ)・す
物事の原因や起こりを調べてはっきりさせる。
「～・せば自分が悪い」

Iほん【本】
a book; a volume; 〔脚本〕 a script 《of a stageplay》.
●分厚い本 a thick [bulky, voluminous] book
・英語の本 an English book
・医学の本 a medical book; a book on medicine
・ものの本によると ⇒もののほん.
●よい本に巡りあう come across [encounter] a good book
・本にかじりつく be stuck to books
・一冊の本になっている be bound up in one volume
・一冊の本にまとめる 〔書き集めて〕 collect 《essays》 into a single volume; 〔編集する〕 compile 《data》 into a book
・本にして出す publish as a book
・彼の雑誌連載文が本になって出た. His serial contributions to magazines came out as a book.
●本の装幀([sub]てい[/sub]) bookbinding
・今まで書きためていたものを本の形で出版する publish in book form writings one has accumulated
・本の間にはさんでおく keep sth between the pages of a book
・〔図書館で〕 本の返却は 2 週間以内にお願いします. Please return books within two weeks.
・それについてはすでにこの本の中で論じた. I have already discussed the matter in this book.
●子供によい本を選んでやる choose a good book for one's child
・本を一枚一枚めくる turn over the leaves of a book
・子供に本を読んで聞かせる read a book to one's child
・本を読みながら眠ってしまう fall asleep while reading a book
・僕だって少しは本を読んでるさ. I'm a bit of a reader myself, too.
・本を出す[出版する] publish [bring out] a book
・図書館で考古学についての本をあさった. I scoured the library for books on archaeology.
・彼は本をたくさん書いている. He is the author of [has written] many books. | He is a prolific writer.
・父はたくさん本を持っている. My father has a large library.
・彼はよく本を読んでいる. He is well-read.
・彼はいつも K 社から本を出す. He always publishes with K. Co.
●この本はイスラムについてなかなかよく書いてある. This book has a good treatment of Islam.
・彼は本ばかり読んでいる. He's always reading books. | All he does is read books.
・その本はただいま在庫を切らしております. That book is out of stock at present. | We haven't got any copies of the book in stock right now.
本離れ
●子供たちの本離れ 《counteract》 the move of children away from reading books.
IIほん-【本-】
1 〔この〕 this; 〔その〕 the same; 〔現在の〕 the present; the current; 〔当の〕 in question; at issue.
●本人 ⇒ほんにん
・本件 this affair [case]; the case (lying) before us; the case in question [at issue]; the case under consideration
・本校 this [our] school
・本協約 the present agreement.
2 〔主な〕 head; main; chief; principal.
●本通り Main Street; a main street
・本館 the main building
・本線 the main line
・本店 the head office
・本予算 the main budget.
3 〔本当の〕 real; 〔正式の〕 regular; normal; proper; plenary; full; full-dress.
●本舞台での稽古 a full-dress rehearsal
・本会議 a plenary session [meeting]; a regular [full-dress] debate
・本名 one's real name
・本工事 《begin》 actual construction [the main construction work].
III-ほん【-本】
●鉛筆 2本 two pencils
・白墨 5本 five pieces of chalk
・ビール 2本 two bottles of beer
・論文 5本 five articles [papers, theses]
・2本のホームラン[シュート] two home runs [shots (on goal)]
・2本の柱 two pillars [posts]
・2本立ての映画 a double feature [《米》 《口》 twin bill]
・赤いバラ 5本 five red roses (with stems).
●映画を 2本見てきた. I've just come from seeing two movies.
IVもと【元･本･許･基･因･素】
1 【元】 〔はじめ〕 the beginning; the genesis 《pl. -ses》; the origin (略: orig.); the rise.
●元は originally; at first
・元から from the first [beginning, outset]; originally
・…が元である originate in [from]…; arise [rise] from…; start from [with]….
●元の original; pristine
・元のままの状態で in 《its》 integrity [original condition]
・道路の幅が元の 2 倍になった. The road has become twice as wide as it was before.
・本を元のところに置く put a book back in its place [where it was]
・その絵は元の状態に復元された. That picture has been restored to its original condition.
●あの人のことは元から信頼のおける人だと思っていました. I have always thought he is a trustworthy man.
・その会社は元は町工場からささやかに始まった. The company had its modest beginning in a humble backstreet workshop.
・その梁([sub]はり[/sub])は太い丸太で, 元は古い帆船のものだった. The beam was a thick log, which came out of some old sailing ship.
・元はと言えばみな君の怠慢から起こったことだ. All this resulted from your negligence.
2 【元】 〔根本〕 the foundation; the basis 《pl. -ses》; 〔根元〕 the source.
●製造元 the manufacturer; the maker
・火の元 ＝ひもと.
●元が悪いのはいくら化粧してもだめだ. If what you start out with isn't good, no matter how much makeup you put on, it's no use.
●元から絶つ cut off 《the evil》 at its source
・病巣を元から絶つ外科手術 surgery to remove a lesion at its source.
●「ぞうさん」の歌を元にした替え歌 a song adapted from the children's song “The Elephant.”
●水道[ガス]の元を止める turn the water [gas] off at the main
・川の元を尋ねる trace a river to [as far as] its source.
●無知は傲慢の元. Ignorance is the mother of impudence. 【諺】
・この慣習の元は儒教にある. This custom originated in [derives its origin from] Confucianism.
3 【本】 〔基本〕 a foundation; a basis.
●農は国の本. Agriculture is the foundation of the state.
4 【元】 〔下のほうやくっついている所に近い部分〕 ((木の)根本) the root 《of a tree》; (元込め銃の銃尾) the breech.
●元が枯れる 《potted plants》 wither at the roots.
●元のほうを持つ hold 《a stick》 at the end.
●バットの元を上にして立てる stand [balance] a baseball bat grip end up.
5 【許･元】 〔そば〕 one's side.
●親許 one's [one's parents'] home.
●師匠の許で修業する study with one's teacher.
●…の許に at…; with…
・叔父の許にいる stay [live] with one's uncle; live at one's uncle's
・その知らせを聞いて彼女の許に駆けつけた. I ran to her side at that news.
●父母の許を離れる leave home [one's parental roof]; go out into the world
・山田さんの許を辞する leave Mr. Yamada's (house).
6 【基】 〔根拠･基礎〕 a basis 《pl. bases》; ground(s); authority.
●…を基にして on the basis of…
・調査資料を基にして意見を述べる express one's opinion based on the findings
・コンピューターのデータを基にして事故原因を調べる investigate the cause of the accident on the basis of (the) computer data
・何を基にそんなことを言うのですか. In what grounds [authority] do you say so?
●…の基を築く lay the foundation(s) 《of…》; lay the groundwork 《for…》.
7 【因】 〔原因〕 the cause; the origin.
●けんか[失敗]のもと the cause of a quarrel [one's failure].
●…がもとで originating in…
・冗談がもとでけんかになった. The quarrel began in a joke.
・風邪がもとで肺炎になることがある. A cold may develop into [result in] pneumonia.
・彼は深酒がもとで若死にした. Too much drinking caused his early death [brought him to an early grave].
●不潔は病気のもとになる. Dirtiness [Uncleanliness] causes [brings on, leads to, gives rise to] disease.
●あなたの失敗のもとは不注意にあるのだ. Your failure is due [attributable] to carelessness. | Carelessness is responsible for your failure.
・ぜいたくは貧乏のもと. Luxury prepares the way to [for] poverty.
・その混乱のもとは情報不足であった. The confusion originated in lack of information.
・口は災いのもと ⇒くち.
8 【素】 〔原料･下地〕 (raw) material(s); a base.
●プリンのもと an instant pudding mix
・市販されているケーキのもと a commercial premix for a cake batter
・スープのもと 〔即席スープ〕 instant soup; 〔スープの下地〕 (soup) stock.
●酒は米をもとにして造る. Sake production starts with rice. | Rice is the basis [starting point] for making sake.
●このスープはよいもとを使ってある. A tasty stock is used in this soup.
・〔酒造りで〕 もとを仕込む 〔酵母を入れる〕 introduce the yeast.
●みそのもとは大豆だ. Miso is made from soybeans.
9 【元】 〔資本〕 capital; 〔元金〕 the principal; 〔元値〕 the cost [prime] price. [＝もとで, もとね]
●元がかかる need [require] capital [an initial outlay]
・この事業は元がかかっている. This enterprise required [involved] a large capital outlay.
・元が切れる be unable to cover the cost.
●元をかける lay out money 《on…》; put [sink] money 《in…》; invest capital 《in an enterprise》
・元を取る earn as much as the capital invested; recover [recoup] one's investment [outlay]; get one's money's worth
・元を取れない fail to return the original investment
・それでは元を取れない. Then I shall be unable to recover the cost.
・その店は元を取れないうちに倒産した. The store went under before it recouped the (original) outlay.
・元を切って売る sell with loss on cost; sell below cost; sell under prime cost.
●この新薬は 3 年未満では元は取れないだろう. This new medicine won't earn [pay off] its cost in less than three years.
・この機械ではすでに元は何倍も取れている. This machine has paid for itself several times (over).
10 【元】 〔以前〕
●元(は) formerly; once; before
・元から from the first
・元茨城県知事 the ex-Governor of Ibaraki Prefecture
・元京都大学教授吉村博士 Dr. Yoshimura, a former professor at Kyoto University
・元代議士 a former member of the Diet
・元総理 a one-time [former] Prime Minister
・元俳優の政治家 an actor-turned-politician
・元市役所だった建物 the building that used to be the municipal office.
●読んだ本を元に戻す return a book to where it was (before) [it belongs, I'd got it].
●元の former; past; ex-; sometime; old-time; one-time; erstwhile; 《文》 quondam; now defunct; 〔退職した〕 retired (略: ret.); 〔昔の〕 of former days; of old days
・彼の元の家 the house where he used to live
・彼女の元の夫 her former husband; 《口》 her ex
・元のままにしておく leave sth as it was
・私の元の教え子たち my former pupils
・元の席に着く resume one's seat
・元の敵 one's former [erstwhile] enemy
・元のとおり ＝もとどおり
・どうやら元のような体になってきた. I'm beginning to feel (like) my old self again.
・元の自分ではないような気がした. I didn't seem to be I was [used to be]. | I feel myself (to be) quite another man.
・作業が終わった者は直ちに元の位置に戻りなさい. Those who have finished their work, return to their original position [where they were before].
・経営方針を元の路線に戻す get the business strategy back onto its previous track.
●元来た道を戻った. We went back the way we had come.
・元うちの庭の真ん中に大きな桐の木があった. There used to be a big paulownia in the center of my garden.
・このブーツは元は若い女性によく売れたものだ. There boots used to sell well among young women.
・祖母は元はとても美人だった. My grandmother was very beautiful in her time.
・してしまったことは元へは戻らない. What's done cannot be undone.
・彼女の視力は元へは戻らなかった. Her sight was never restored.
11 【元】 〔以前の姿; 素性〕 one's origin; one's antecedents.
●元を調べる trace sth to its origin
・元をただす inquire into sb's past [precedents]
・元をただせば originally; in its origin
・彼女の家系は元をただせば江戸後期までさかのぼることができる. Her origins can be traced back to the late Edo period.
・あの人たちは元をただせば京都の旧家の出です. They originally come from an old family in Kyoto.
・彼は元をただせば暴走族のリーダーだ. He was formerly the boss of a motorcycle gang.
元のさやに納まる get back together; be reconciled 《with her former husband》.
●前の夫のほうがわびを入れて結局二人は元のさやに納まった. The pair were eventually reconciled after the woman's former husband made an apology.
元の木阿弥([sub]もくあみ[/sub]) (a) relapse.
●元の木阿弥になる lose all (that) one has gained; be (right) back where one started
・両親が残してくれた財産をすべて使い果たし, また元の木阿弥だ. I spent all the money my parents left me, and I am as pinched for money [hard-up] as I was before.
元も子もない 〈人が主語〉 lose everything; 〈物が主語〉 come to nothing; be wasted.
●お母さんの介護疲れであなたが倒れてしまっては元も子もない. If you drop from exhaustion tending your aged mother, it's all over for both of you.
・元も子もなくなる lose both principal and interest; suffer a total loss
・彼女の無責任な発言で 1 年ものわれわれの努力が元も子もなくなった. Her irresponsible remark meant that our year's hard work went [disappeared] down the drain.

じまん【自慢】
pride; boast(ing); self-praise[-applause]; conceit; self-admiration[-conceit]; vanity; vainglory.
～する 〔口で〕 boast [brag] about 《one's voice》; speak proudly of 《one's son》; be boastful; 〔心で〕 pride [《文》 plume] oneself 《on…》; be proud of [take pride in] 《one's country》; have a good opinion of oneself.
●自慢する人 a boaster; a bragger; a braggart
・(物を)自慢して見せる show off; make a display [show] of sth; 《口》 flash; sport
・美貌を自慢する be proud of [plume oneself on] one's good looks
・家を自慢する be proud of one's house [house-proud]
・家柄を自慢する boast about [be proud of] one's family (tree)
・息子を自慢する boast about [be proud of] one's son; tell everyone how wonderful [clever, etc.] one's son is
・腕前を自慢する boast [brag] about one's skill; be proud of one's skill
・手柄を自慢する boast [brag, go on] about one's achievements; talk about one's exploits with pride
・他人に自慢できるものなど私には何もない. I've got nothing to boast about. | I'm a very ordinary sort of person. | I haven't achieved anything special.
●自慢じゃないが though I say so [it] myself…; I don't want to brag, but…; without wanting to brag, 《I think it's perfect》; it's nothing to boast about, but…
・自慢じゃないがこれまで病気欠席したことがない. Though I say it myself, [I'm not boasting, but] I've never been off sick.
・自慢じゃないが運動はまったくだめです. Though I say it myself, I'm hopeless at sports.
・自慢ではないが私の替え歌は大受けだった. With all due modesty I can say that [Though I say so myself,] my takeoff (of the song) was a great success.
●祖父はコイが自慢で自慢で, 来客みんなに見せびらかす. My grandfather is so proud of his carp that he shows them to everyone who comes. | My grandad is as proud as proud can be about his carp and displays them to all his visitors.
●あまり自慢にもならないがこれまで一度もギャンブルに手を出したことがない. It's nothing much to boast about, but I've never gambled in my life.
・そんなことは自慢にならない. That's nothing to boast about [brag about, be proud of].| That doesn't [won't, wouldn't] do you any credit.
・そんなことができたって自慢にも何にもなりゃしない. It is not to your credit to be able to do such a thing.
・父は子供が 7 人いることを自慢にしている. My father is proud of the fact that he has [having] seven children. | My Dad has seven kids and he's proud of it [thinks it's an achievement].
●自慢の種 something to boast about; a boast; a feather in one's cap
・自慢のお宝 (one of) one's proudest possessions; a proud possession (of one's)
・これが彼の自慢のランだ. This is the orchid he's so proud of. | This orchid is his pride and joy.
・あれが父親の自慢の息子です. That boy is his father's pride and joy. | He's the pride and joy of his father, that young man.
・あれが彼の自慢の娘です. That's the daughter he is so proud of [always boasting about]. | That's his daughter, his pride and joy [the pride and joy of his life].
・当店自慢のレモンケーキが今日は 2 割引です. Our special lemon cakes [Lemon cakes, a speciality of ours,] are 20% off today.
・現政府自慢の改革は期待に反するものとなっている. The (much-)vaunted reforms of the present Administration have been disappointing.
●彼女は声が自慢です. She is proud of her voice. | Her voice is what she's proud of.
・自慢高慢馬鹿のうち. Braggarts fall into the category of fools.
・当地は水がきれいだ. それだけが自慢だ. The water here is clear. That's our only boast [the only thing we pride ourselves on].

もともと【元元】
〔「元」を重ね， 意味を強めた語〕
※一※ （副）
はじめから。 もとから。 本来。 元来。
「～私のものだ」「～彼には責任をとる気はなかった」「～根はやさしい男」
※二※ （名・形動）
元とくらべて大差ないこと。 損も得もなく前と同じような状態であること。
「失敗しても～だ」

もともと【元々】

1 〔元来〕 from the first [beginning, outset]; originally; always; 〔生来〕 by nature; naturally.
●元々人間はまねが好きだ. People are born imitative. | Love of imitation is inherent in human nature.
・彼は元々怠け者だ. Laziness is innate in him. | He is inherently [was born] a lazy creature.
・その本, 元々はだれの物なの? Who originally owned that book? | Who is the original owner of that book?

2 〔損も得もなく元の通りであること〕
●万一失敗しても元々だ. If I failed, I'd be none the worse than before.
・彼は負けて元々と思ってチャンピオンに挑戦した. He challenged the champion as he thought that even if he were beaten, he would be none the worse for it.

しんけい【神経】
(1)生体の運動・知覚をつかさどり， 一つの個体としてまとまった動きをするように各部分を統率し， おのおのの神経細胞が受けた刺激を伝達する経路。 ヒトでは， 精神作用をも営む中枢神経と末梢に分布する末梢神経とからなり， 各神経は神経細胞と神経繊維とからなる。 狭義には， 末梢神経をいう。
(2)外界の物事を鋭敏に感じ取って反応する心のはたらき。
「応対に～を使う」「～を逆撫(ナ)でする」「繊細な～の持ち主」
～に触(サワ)・る
その人の神経を必要以上に刺激して， いらいらさせる。
～を尖(トガ)ら・せる
各方面に注意を払う。 また， 必要以上に気をつかって過敏になる。

しんけい【神経】
1 【解】 〔刺激伝達器官〕 a nerve; neuron.
●歯の神経が出ているのです. You have an exposed nerve in your tooth.

・神経のない nerveless.
●神経を抜く extract a nerve.
2 〔心の働き〕 sensitivity.
●神経が高ぶる one's nerves become edgy; 〈人が主語〉 become excited [jittery, touchy]
・神経が高ぶっている be highly strung; be high-strung; be jittery
・神経が休まる 〈人が主語〉 relax; get some peace and quiet; take it easy
・神経が太い[細い] be daring [timid]; be bold [hesitant]; be thick-[thin-]skinned

・彼は神経がくたくたになっていた[神経をすり減らしていた]. His nerves were shot. | He was a nervous wreck. | 《米》 《口》 He had come to the end of his rope.
・彼は神経がまいりかけていた. He was running on nervous energy.
・すみずみにまで神経が行き届いている. She pays attention to the smallest detail.

・その騒音は彼女の疲れた神経にこたえた. The noise grated on her tired nerves.
・みんな彼女の神経に触らないように細心の注意を払っていた. Everyone took extra care not to get on her nerves.
●ずぶとい神経の持ち主 a person with a lot of nerve; a nervy [brazen, presumptuous] person
・神経の鋭い[とがった] nervous; sensitive; susceptible; jumpy; touchy; edgy

・だれにも言えないような経験 the kind of experience one cannot tell anyone about

1 〔物事を論理的に判定すること〕 judgment; adjudication; (断定) decision; (結論) conclusion; (推論) inference; (推断) assessment; estimation; (裁量) discretion.
～する judge; form a judgment; assess; pass judgment 《on…》; decide; infer; estimate; gauge; 《口》 size up.
●軽率に判断する judge 《sb》 hastily; come to a hasty conclusion
・善悪を判断する judge [distinguish between] good and evil; make a moral judgment
・外見によって人を判断する judge (people) by appearances
・文脈から言葉の意味を判断する determine [decide, pick up] meaning from context; use context to decide what 《a word》 means
・うわさから判断すると彼はなかなかのやり手らしい. Judging from the rumors, [Rumor has it that] he is pretty impressive.
・私たちは彼を言葉の癖から関西人と判断した. From his speech we concluded [decided] that he was [must be] from the Kansai.
・バッターは向かってくるボールの位置や速さを瞬時に判断してそこにバットを出す. The batter decides instantly where to put his bat according to the speed and position of the ball.
●正しい[誤った]判断 correct [mistaken] judgment [assessment]
・的確な判断 accurate assessment [judgment]
・事故機は機長の的確な判断によって無事着陸した. Thanks to good judgment on the part of the pilot the damaged plane landed safely.
・冷静な判断 cool [calm] judgment; dispassionate assessment.
●判断が正しい one's judgment [assessment] is right; judge right; make a [the] correct decision [judgment, assessment]
・果たしてこの霧がいつ晴れるのか私には判断がつかない. I can't judge [say] when this fog may lift.
・景気予測はなかなか判断がむずかしい. It is extremely difficult to forecast what the economy is going to do [judge what may happen to the economy].
・判断が甘かった. I was over-optimistic. | I expected too much.
・試合ではいつもとっさの判断が必要になる. In a match you always have to decide instantly [make spur-of-the moment decisions].
●リーダーの判断で僕たちは下山を決めた. In accordance with the leader's assessment of the situation, we decided to go [come] down. | The leader decided that we should go [come] down.
・はい, それは自分の判断でやりました. That's right. I did it on my own initiative [at my own discretion].
・私の判断では as I see it [far as I can judge]; in my view [judgment, opinion]; to me.
●君の判断によって at your own discretion; as you see fit
・ご判断に任せます. I leave (it to) you to judge for yourself. | I leave it to you [your judgment]. | You decide.
・上司の判断に従う do whatever one's boss says; follow orders
・買うべきかどうか判断に迷う時はやめておくことにしている. When I'm not sure [I can't decide] whether I should buy something my policy is not to buy it.
●判断の規準 a criterion [criteria] (for judging); the criteria one uses for judgment; how one judges
・判断の根拠 the basis [grounds] for judgment; the facts on which one bases a judgment.
●慎重な判断を下す decide [judge, assess 《something》] cautiously [carefully]; make a cautious decision; 《文》 be circumspect
・正しい判断を下す make the right decision [assesment, judgment]; decide correctly
・判断を誤る judge wrong [wrongly, 《文》 erroneously]; make the wrong decision; make an error of judgment; misjudge; miscalculate; get 《it, things》 wrong; 《文》 err in judgment
・採決の結果が可否同数だったので議長の判断を仰ぐことになった. Since there was no clear majority, we left the decision to the chairman.

2 〔占い〕 divination.
状況判断 assessment of the situation; judging according to the circumstances [situation].
性格判断
●血液型による性格判断 interpreting [judging, assessing] character by [according to] blood type.
姓名判断 divination which predicts on the base of a person's name whether the future will bring good or bad fortune; 《文》 onomancy.
夢判断 reading [interpreting] dreams; the reading [interpretation] of dreams; 《文》 oneirocriticism; oneiroscopy.
判断材料 materials [evidence] for judging; facts [things, something] to go on.
判断中止 【哲】 suspension of judgment.
判断ミス an error of judgment; 《口》 getting 《it》 wrong.

こわれる【壊れる・毀れる】
(1)物の形が崩れたりばらばらになったりする。
「皿が～・れる」「地震でビルが～・れる」
(2)機械・器具が正常な働きをしなくなる。 故障する。
「テレビが～・れる」
(3)計画や約束がまとまらなくなる。 成り立たなくなる。 だめになる。
「計画が～・れる」「商談が～・れる」

こわれる【壊れる】

1 〔ものの形が損なわれる〕 break; be [get] broken; be destroyed; be wrecked; collapse; fall [blow, burn, come] down; fall [blow, come] apart; fall to pieces; break up; smash; 〔成分が失われる〕 break down; dissolve; destroy.
●壊れた箱 a broken box
・突風で壊れた家 a house destroyed by [blown down in] a squall
・壊れやすい構造 a fragile structure [construction]; a frail [breakable, brittle, flimsy] structure; an easily damaged structure; a structurally weak design
・壊れにくい構造 a strong [sturdy, tough, robust] structure [construction]; a structure which is resistant to wear and tear; a structurally strong design
・壊れかけている家 a dilapidated [derelict, tumbledown] house; a house which is falling down
・粉々に壊れる be smashed to bits [pieces, smithereens]; be totally smashed [destroyed]; smash [shiver, pulverize, fragment] to pieces
・ばらばらに壊れる fall apart; fall to bits [pieces]; break up
・めちゃめちゃに壊れる be totally [completely] destroyed; break to pieces; be (completely) wrecked
・加熱しても壊れにくい栄養分 nutrients not easily broken down by heat; nutrients resistant to heat.
●地震で橋が壊れて落ちた. A bridge collapsed [fell down, was destroyed] in the earthquake.
・帰宅したらこの花瓶が壊れていたのです. The vase was broken [smashed] when I got home. | When I got home I found the vase smashed [in pieces].
・箱の中のものが壊れないように静かに運んでください. Please take this box carefully so that the things inside don't get broken [you don't break the things inside].

2 〔機能しなくなる〕 break; break down; stop working; cease functioning; go wrong; 《文》 malfunction; 《口》 bust; go haywire; conk (out).
●壊れた洗濯機 a broken washing machine.
●テレビが壊れて音が出ない. The television is [has] broken and it doesn't produce any sound.| Something has gone wrong with the television and you can't hear anything.
・ブレーキが壊れている. The brakes don't [won't] work.
・かぎが壊れた. The lock got broken [broke].| Something went wrong with the lock.

3 〔うまくいかなくなる〕 stop going smoothly; be doomed; 〔破綻する〕 collapse; break down; fail; fall apart; go up in smoke; 〔台なしになる〕 be ruined.
●その計画は彼の反対で壊れた. The project collapsed because of his opposition. | His opposition stopped [put paid to, brought down, doomed] the scheme.
・縁談が壊れる原因は経済問題が多い. Marriage plans often break up over [don't work out because of] money. | Economic circumstances often put paid to marriage proposals.
・そんなことをすればわれわれの信頼関係が壊れてしまう. If you do that we'll stop trusting each other. | That would destroy our trust in each other.
・その発言で彼の理知的なイメージは完全に壊れた. When he said that his image as an intellectual was completely destroyed. | This (statement) completely destroyed [ruined, wrecked] his image as an intellectual.
・長年の夢が一瞬にして壊れた. My long-standing dream was destroyed in an instant [went up in smoke]. | That was the end of my long-cherished dream.
・停電でハードディスク内のデータが壊れた. The power cut destroyed the data on my hard disk.
・一度壊れた友情を修復するのは容易でない. It's not easy to put back together a friendship that has failed [broken down, collapsed, fallen apart].
・合併の話は突然壊れた. The amalgamation talks suddenly collapsed [broke down].
・このちょっとしたことですっかり気分が壊れた. This little thing ruined the atmosphere.
・バイクの騒音で甘いムードが壊れた. The noise [roar] of motorbikes ruined the romantic atmosphere.
・(野球で)救援投手が不調で試合が壊れてしまった. The relief pitcher's poor form ruined the game. | The game ended in defeat [We were beaten] because the relief pitcher was off form.

4 〔両替できる〕 ⇒くずれる 2.

Iか【科】
1 〔学科〕 a course; (大学の) a department; a faculty; a school; 〔教科〕 a branch of study; a specialization.

けんとう【見当】
(1)未知の事柄について立てた見込み。 予想。
「おおよその～を付ける」「全く～が付かない」「～が外れる」
(2)大体の方向・方角。
「真北はこの～だろう」
(3)弓矢の的(マト)。
(4)版画や印刷で， 刷る位置を示す目印。 また， 多色刷りで， 刷り重ねる時の目印。 とんぼ。
(5)（数詞の下に付けて接尾語的に用いて）その数量程度であることを表す。
「一万円～の謝礼」

けんとう【見当】
1 〔方角〕 a direction; a way; bearings; 〔見込み〕 a guess; a conjecture; an estimate.
●見当がつく suppose; guess; imagine
・おおよその見当がつく get [have] a rough idea 《of…》
・それがどんなものか, 大体見当がついている. I think I can pretty much guess what it must be like.
・君が何を言いたいか, それで見当がついた. Now I think I see what you're getting at.
・見当がつかない cannot imagine; have no idea 《of…》; be unable to guess; be (left) in the dark; 《米》 be unable to figure 《it》 out
・方角の見当がつかなくなる lose one's bearings
・出口はどこか見当がつかなかった. I had no idea (of) how to get out.
・それが何のために作られた物なのかまるで見当がつかない. I have absolutely no idea what it was made for.
・だれが金を盗んだかいまだに見当がつかない. We still have no idea who stole the money.
・次に何が起こるか見当がつかない. Nobody knows [can tell] what's going to happen next.
・おおよその見当しかつかない. Only a very rough guess [the roughest sort of estimate] is possible.
・少しも[まったく, 一向に]見当がつかない. It is impossible to make the wildest guess. | I haven't the faintest [least, slightest] idea. | I don't have the slightest clue. | 《口》 I haven't the faintest.
・見当が外れる 〔ねらいが〕 miss (the mark [target]); 〔推測が〕 guess wrong; make a wrong guess; be wide of the mark; 《口》 be way out [off beam]; 〔読み違いをする〕 misread; misinterpret; 《口》 miss the boat.
●私のおよその見当では by [in] my rough estimation, …; if I had to make a (rough) guess, 《I'd say that…》
・費用はこんな見当でどうですか? What do you say to this as a rough estimate of the cost?
●北はおよそあの山の見当に当たる. North is roughly in the direction of that mountain.
●見当のつかない広さ immeasurable size [width, breadth]
・何に使うか見当のつかない道具 a tool whose purpose [the purpose of which] is impossible to guess
・警察にも犯人の見当のつかない事件 a crime which the police have no idea who committed.
●見当をつける 〔ねらう〕 take aim at…; aim at…; 〔見積もる〕 estimate; make [give] an estimate; 〔推測する〕 guess
・大方ここにいるだろうと見当をつけて来てみたんだ. I came thinking I might find you here.
・地図がないので大まかな見当をつけて歩きだした. I didn't have a map, so I set off in the general direction (I thought it would be).
●近ごろの若い者の好みは見当もつかない. I have no idea what sort of things young people like these days.
・そろそろ向こうに着く見当だ. They should be getting [arriving] there about now.
・「来春までにはでき上がりますか」「まあそんな見当でしょう」 “Do you think you'll have it [you can get it] done by next spring?”―“That sounds about right.”
・だれが盗んだか薄々見当はついている. I have a hunch who stole it.
・二人はてっきり夫婦だと思ったのだが, どうやらその見当は外れたようだ. I was sure they were married, but it looks like I was off [my guess was wide of] the mark.
2 〔(数量が)おおよその〕 about; around 《three hours》; approximately; in the region [《口》 neighborhood] of 《5 million yen》.
●50 歳見当の人 a person of around fifty [fifty or thereabouts]; a fiftyish person
・お歳暮の予算は 1 件 5,000 円見当です. I plan to spend about 5,000 yen each on year-end presents.
●避難所での毛布は 1 人 2 枚見当で用意した. We have about two blankets per person ready at the emergency shelter.
3 【印刷】 register.

まがる【曲(が)る】
〔「禍(マガ)」の動詞化〕
(1)まっすぐな物・平らな物が弓形・ S 字形などになる。
「腰が～・る」「肘(ヒジ)が痛くて右腕が～・らない」「青柳の細き眉根を笑み～・り/万葉 4192」
(2)進む方向が右または左に変わる。
「駅は次の四つ角を右に～・ったところだ」「道は北に～・る」
(3)向きが正規の方向とずれる。 ゆがむ。 傾く。
「ネクタイが～・っている」「柱が～・って見える」
(4)道理からはずれる。 心がねじける。
「根性が～・っている」
〔「曲げる」に対する自動詞〕
‖可能‖ まがれる
︱慣用︱ 口が～・旋毛(ツムジ)が～・鼻が～
曲がった事
道理にはずれたこと。 不正なこと。
「～は大きらいだ」

まがる【曲がる】
⇒まがった.

1 〔形が変わる〕 (弓状に) bend; arc; (くの字に) bend; make a 90-degree turn; 【解】 〔関節が動く〕 flex; 〔方向が変わる〕 turn; make a turn.
●曲がった釘 a bent nail.
●この針金は道具なしで[簡単に]曲がる. This wire can be bent by hand [bends easily].
・針が曲がっている. The needle is bent.
・年を取って腰が曲がってしまった. My back has bent with age.
・ひざが痛くて曲がらない. My knee hurts and I can't bend it.
・彼のひじはけがで曲がったままだ. His elbow is still bent from an injury.
・道は公園に沿って曲がっている. The road bends around the edge of the park.
・川は東京寄りにぐうっと曲がっている. The river makes a great sweep towards Tokyo.
・黄河はそこで東に大きく曲がっている. The Yellow River takes its great eastward bend there.
・桑田投手のカーブはよく曲がる. Kuwata's curveball breaks well.
・カーブを投げたが曲がらなかった. 〔野球で〕 I threw a curveball but it didn't break.
・ボールは大きく曲がってゴールを割った. 〔サッカーで〕 The ball made a big arc and made its way into the goal.

2 〔道を折れる〕 make a bend [turn]; 〔カーブに沿う〕 turn; round.
●左に曲がる turn [strike] to the left (hand); turn left; take a left-hand turn 《on a road》
・角を大きく[ぎりぎりに]曲がる 〔車で〕 turn a corner widely [closely, tightly]; make a wide [tight] turn (at a corner)
・カーブを曲がる turn [negotiate] a curve.
●家は角を曲がった所だ. The house is [stands] 《米》 around [《英》 round] the corner.
・この角を左に曲がってまっすぐですよ. Turn this street corner to the left and go straight on.
・列車は山角を曲がった. The train curved around a hill.
・僕はここを曲がります. Here's where I turn (off).
・その角を曲がった所で降ろしてください. 〔運転手に〕 Please drop me off just after you turn that corner.
・車は角を曲がりきれずに塀に衝突した. The car didn't negotiate the turn and plowed into a wall [fence].

3 〔ずれる〕 slip out of place; 〔ゆがむ〕 warp; 〔傾く〕 lean; incline; 〔ひねくれる〕 become crooked; become perverse; become cross-grained.
●〔手書きの〕 字の列が曲がる the writing goes out of line
・留め金が曲がる the clasp goes awry [bends out of place].

かんしん【感心】
～な admirable 《conduct》; praiseworthy 《person》; laudable 《act》.
～する (greatly) admire; be struck with admiration; be (deeply, greatly, favorably) impressed with [by]…; think highly [well] of…; be moved 《by a performance》; be touched 《by sb's conduct》; find sb [sth] impressive [admirable, laudable].
●あの子の勉強ぶりには感心する. I'm very impressed by [I really admire] the way that child works. | The way that child studies really impresses me.

・たまには親を感心させることをしてみろ. Try and do something to impress your parents [give us a nice surprise] for a change.
・彼のプレーにはさすがメジャー･リーグと感心させられた. The way he played the game impressed me as being what Major League Baseball is all about.
・君が今すぐ彼に会うのは感心しない. I don't think you should [it would be advisable for you to] meet him straight away.
・そのようにいつも他人を当てにするのは感心しないね. I don't think much of [take a dim view of] the way you always turn to other people. | I don't approve of [hold with] your always depending on other people.
・落ち込んでいる人を叱咤激励するのは感心できません. It's no good [I don't recommend] giving people pep talks when they're depressed.
●感心な子[生徒] an admirable child [student]; a child [student] who deserves praise
・お前は感心な子だ. You're a great kid. | What a good boy [girl]!
●おお感心感心! Well done! | Great! Great! | Good for you! | That's the way!
・彼女の感心な点はけっして人の悪口を言わないことだ. One of her good points is that she never says nasty things about other people. | One admirable thing about her is that she never criticizes people.

なまり【鉛】

はる【春】
(1)四季の一。 冬と夏の間の季節。 現行の太陽暦では三月から五月まで。 陰暦では正月から三月まで。 また， 二十四節気では立春から立夏の前日まで。 天文学上では， 春分から夏至(ゲシ)の前日まで。 昼が長く， 夜が短くなる。 一年中で最も陽気がよく植物の発育期にあたる。 「冬が過ぎて～が来る」﹝季﹞春。

I ほんと【本当】
「ほんとう（本当）」の転。 会話語として使われる。
「え， ～か」「～の話はこうなんだ」

II ほんとう【本当】
(1)まちがっていたり， うそであったりしない・こと（さま）。 真実。 事実。 本物。 ほんと。
⇔ うそ
「～のことを言う」「その話は～だ」「～を言うと， 私は行きたくない」「それは～なのか」「～の友達」
(2)本来そうあるべきであること。 当然なすべきこと。
「体が～ではない」「～はこちらがあやまらなければならない」「代理でなくて本人が来るのが～だ」

ほんとう【本当】
1 〔真実･事実･実際〕
●本当は in (point of) fact; actually; in reality [actuality]; really; as a matter of fact; the truth (of the matter) is 《that…》
・それが本当でもうそでも whether that's the truth or a lie [true or false].
●本当に 〔嘘ではなく〕 truly; really; actually; for real; 〔本気で〕 in (real) earnest [⇒本当に]
・君は本当にそう思ってるのか. Do you really think that (way)?
・本当にする believe; take sth seriously; accept sth as true
・人の言うことを本当にする take sb at his word
・だれがそんな話を本当にするものか. Who would believe a story like that? | Tell that to the marines!
・本当にそうなのか(＝本気か). Do you really mean what you say?
・これは去年本当にあったことなんだ. This (is something that) really happened last year.
●本当の 〔真の〕 true; real; actual; 〔事実上の〕 veritable; 〔実在する〕 substantial
・本当のこと the truth; a fact; a reality
・本当のことを言えば to speak the truth; truth to tell; to tell you the truth; in reality
・では本当のことを言います. Okay, I'll tell you the truth.
・本当のところはどうなんだ? Now tell me what really happened.
・本当の私[自分]を探す search for the real me
・本当の友だち a true friend
・本当の兄弟 one's real [true] brother; full brothers
・本当の悪人 a real rascal
・本当の意味での幸福 happiness in the true sense of the word
・その語の本当の意味において in the true [truest, real] meaning of the word [term]
・本当の年を教えてください. Tell me your real age [how old you really are].
・彼は決して本当の気持ちを明かさない. He never lays bare [gives away] his real [true] feelings.
・この地方の本当の寒さはこんなものじゃない. This is nothing like how cold it really gets in these parts.
・あれこそ本当の芸人だ. Now that's what I call a real entertainer!
●本当だね. 〔同意して〕 I agree with you. | 〔念を押して〕 You're not kidding me now, are you?
・それって本当? Can it be true? | Is that really true?
・〔驚いて〕 本当ですか. Really? | Really and truly? | 〔まさか!〕 You don't say! | You're kidding.
・本当かどうかわからないことを人に言うものではない. Never say anything that you don't know to be true [for certain].
・彼の言っていることは本当らしい. He seems to be telling the truth.
・本当言うと私は彼が好きじゃないんだ. To tell the truth, I don't like him.
・本当は彼は解雇されたのだ. The truth is, he was fired.
・「急がば回れ」とは本当だ. “Make haste slowly”―truer words were never spoken.
・大丈夫, それは本当だよ. Take it from me [Take my word for it], it's true.
・彼女離婚だって, 本当だよ. You know the rumor that she's getting divorced? Well, it's true.
・私はそんなことはしていません, 本当です. I didn't do it; on my word of honor.
・彼女にちょっと仕事を教えてもらってただけなんだ. 本当だってば. She was only explaining to me what I have to do in my job, that's all. Honestly.
2 〔本来･本筋〕
●本当の 〔正しい〕 proper; right
・それが本当のやり方だ. That's the proper [right] way to go about it.
●本当を言えば properly speaking; to speak properly
・本当を言えばこれは論理学の題目だ. Properly speaking, this subject belongs to logic.
●…と呼ぶのが本当だろう. It would be proper to call it….
・体調はまだ本当ではない. I'm not fully recovered yet. | I'm still not quite my old self.
・本当はそんなことはできないのだが…. Strictly speaking, that's not supposed to be done, but….
・本当はこれは松でこしらえるべきなんだが. By rights, this should be made of pine(wood).
・本当はまだ安静にしてなくちゃいけないんだけど. I'm supposed to still be resting [staying] in bed.
3 〔本物〕
●本当の genuine; authentic; 〔人工的でない〕 natural
・本当の真珠 a natural pearl; 〔にせ物ではない〕 a real [genuine] pearl
・この造花はまるで本当の花のようだ. This artificial flower looks just like a real one.
本当に 〔まったく, 実に〕 really; quite; indeed; very.
●君が来てくれて本当によかった. It was a good thing (that) you came. | Am I (ever) glad you came!
・彼は本当に気が利いている. He's a really thoughtful person.
・本当に美しい風景だった. The scene was really beautiful.
・本当に寒いね. Boy, it's really cold!
・本当にくやしい. I could really kick myself.
・本当におもしろかった. We've had a rattling good time.
・本当にありがとう. Thank you very much indeed.

Iいきさつ【経緯】
〔事情〕 the state of affairs; the circumstances [picture]; the situation; conditions; the way things are; (内々の) (confidential) reasons; 〔経過〕 the way things have been going; course of events; developments.
●恋の経緯 the story [history] of a love affair.

●どういう経緯だったのかは知らない. I don't know (exactly) how it happened [came about].
・公にはできない経緯もあった. There were (various) reasons why we had to keep it private [secret]. | Circumstances made it impossible [inadvisable, inappropriate] to let the matter out.

きげん【機嫌】
a mood; a humor; spirits; temper. [⇒ごきげん]
●機嫌がよい be in a good humor [mood]; be cheerful
・一杯やって機嫌がいい be mellow after a few drinks; have had a drink and be in a good mood; be warm with wine
・非常に機嫌がよい be in very good humor [a very good mood]; be in high spirits
・機嫌が悪い be in an ill [a bad] humor [mood]; be out of humor [sorts]; be in a bad temper; be in an ugly mood; be cross 《at sth, with sb》; 〔朝起きてから〕 get out of bed on the wrong side; get out of [up on] the wrong side of the bed
・とても機嫌が悪い be (as) cross as a bear
